This is the one our team swears by &#8212; <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trtl-travel-pillow-review-2018-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">you can read a review here</a>.</p>\n\tA guide full of inspiration for her future adventures\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c096c3cd5000c01fe47d048?format=jpeg\" alt=\"the bucket list book\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Anthropologie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The Bucket List, available at <a href=\"http://go.redirectingat.com/?id=35871X943606&#38;xcust=biip_101518-gifts-for-her-under-50&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.anthropologie.com%2Fshop%2Fthe-bucket-list%3Fcategory%3Dholiday-gifts-under-50%26color%3D040\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Anthropologie ($35)</a>&#160;and <a href=\"https://amzn.to/2NYAKam\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow\">Amazon ($28.99)</a></h3><p>This worldwide bucket list won't cure her wanderlust, but it'll definitely provide her inspiration and fodder for planning her travels.</p>\n\tA set of tinted lip balms\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d6edcbb2e22af0f613b7643?format=jpeg\" alt=\"fresh sugar lip balm\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Nordstrom</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://shop-links.co/1721443393650854916\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Fresh Sugar Tinted Lip Treatment, available at Nordstrom, $24</a></h3><p>If her beauty preferences tend to be more on the natural side, it's likely she loves a good tinted lip balm. Fresh makes some of the best &#8212; the color options are universally flattering and the easy, and the formula is smooth, hydrating, and buttery.</p>\n\tA dainty pair of hoops that are anything but average\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d5ec833bbb7c6347d42b873?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tiny Secret Trinity Studs Star Hoops 1_2048x2048\" height=\"750\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Maison Miru</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://shareasale.com/m-pr.cfm?merchantid=80900&#38;userid=1088116&#38;productid=816065087&#38;afftrack=\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow\">Shooting Star Open Hoop Earrings, available at Maison Miru, $39</a></h3><p>It seems like everyone on our team has a pair of these open hoops. Their horseshoe shape is just different enough to set them apart, while a tiny, twinkly cubic zirconia catches the light just enough to add a bit of sparkle.</p>\n\tA customizable box of candy for adults\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d5ec85d00ef2b306e323663?format=jpeg\" alt=\"34276073_2107162006234359_9022866363428896768_n\" height=\"810\" width=\"1080\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sugarfina</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sugarfina.com%2Fdesign-your-own-4-piece-candy-bento-box\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Four-Piece Candy Bento Box, available at Sugarfina, $36</a></h3><p>Satisfy her sweet tooth with a custom box of candy. Sugarfina's candies are distinctly \"adult\" &#8212; but she'll still feel like a kid when she digs into a box of ros&#233; gummies.</p>\n\tAn armband that holds her phone on runs or at the gym\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d5ec96ecd97842be01cf718?format=jpeg\" alt=\"61b6Cst1icL._SL1024_\" height=\"768\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Resistant-Armband-Samsung-Adjustable-Elastic/dp/B00SXRXUFE/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=sl1&#38;tag=biip_101518-gifts-for-her-under-50-20&#38;linkId=f1b479b2aae54f37b28c0f8402befa06&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Tribe Water-Resistant Arm Band, available at Amazon, $14.98</a></h3><p>If she loves to run or spends a lot of time at the gym, this top-rated arm band will definitely be a lifesaver for her. Just make sure you know what model phone she carries as you may have to check different brands for different phone sizes.&#160;</p>\n\tA makeup and skincare subscription\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d5ec99cadbcf82b4437fb52?format=jpeg\" alt=\"unnamed 1\" height=\"2828\" width=\"3771\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Birchbox</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=38138&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.birchbox.com%2Fgift%2Fhome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Birchbox three month gift subscription, $45</a></h3><p>Birchbox is a skincare and makeup subscription that sends tons of beauty samples for her to test out and play around with. They can also use the aux-in port to play music from their phone.</p>\n\tThe newest version of the most popular Fitbit for fitness and sleep tracking\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cc30faefa99af081413f768?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fitbit Charge 3\" height=\"937\" width=\"1250\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Fitbit</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.fitbit.com/global/us/products/trackers/charge4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Fitbit Charge 4 Fitness Tracker, available at Fitbit, $149.95</a></h3><p>Fitbits help the wearer measure and track their health and fitness, including sleep patterns and activity trends. They can set goals and get real-time stat updates during workouts to see how they can improve. It's also water-resistant and has a battery life that lives up to seven days.</p>\n\tA cool weekender for sleepovers that not everyone will have yet\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bf31d04110d4c0509331bbc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dagne Dover 2\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dagne Dover</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dagnedover.com%2Fcollections%2Fthe-landon-carryall\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Unisex Landon Carryall, available at Dagne Dover, from $95</a></h3><p>Dagne Dover is a cult-favorite handbag startup and their weekender bags make for a unique and useful unisex gift. It's made from neoprene (think: scuba gear), and has an impressive internal organization system (padded laptop sleeve, water bottle pocket, and stretch key leash for easy access). It's great for weekend trips, sleepovers, and as a carry-on, and comes in a ton of colors.</p>\n\tA soft $100 cashmere sweater they can wear with anything\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bbb9383ac0a630d7b1c65d6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Everlane $100 cashmere sweater review\" height=\"810\" width=\"1080\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Everlane</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TEFNS0VFQUVHR0pGTEFFREhLRE0?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.everlane.com%2Fproducts%2Fwomens-cashmere-crew2-lightoatmeal\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Cashmere Crew, available at Everlane, $100</a></h3><p>Everlane is a cult-favorite startup, and&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/everlane-cashmere-sweater-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">its $100 cashmere sweaters are one of its most popular products ever for a reason</a>&#8212; they're soft, come in 18 colors, and the owner can pair this with pretty much anything during the cold season.</p><p>If they're especially environmentally conscious,&#160;<a href=\"https://fave.co/2OxLw7K\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">check out Reformation's 70% recycled cashmere</a>&#160;or&#160;<a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=50d08f80-6a3b-4a15-90d3-1b7c09b770b0&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.patagonia.com%2Fsearch%2F%3Fq%3Drecycled%2Bcashmere%26lang%3Den_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Patagonia's recycled cashmere</a>. If you're looking for something less expensive, cashmere startup Naadam has&#160;<a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/TUJGRk1OR0JGSEhLR01CRktOSEVG?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnaadam.co%2Fcollections%2Fthe-75-cashmere-sweater%2Fproducts%2Fthe-essential-75-cashmere-sweater-womens%3Fvariant%3D32474756776032\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">fantastic cashmere sweaters for $75</a>, but&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/naadam-cashmere-sweater-review-2018-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">they're prone to sell out</a>.</p>\n\tA pack of smart plugs so they can control devices from a distance\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa04d4c6f5b310011724dd2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gifts for teens TP Link\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Ftp-link-kasa-smart-wi-fi-plug-mini-white%2F5763116.p%3FskuId%3D5763116%26ref%3D212%26loc%3D1%26ref%3D212%26loc%3DDWA%26gclid%3DCjwKCAjw3-bzBRBhEiwAgnnLChvHyuOs6YSB0x0OsioYDnp7ATB1uVHSoVQ2mEjXM9ygeic7U-mxrxoCpbcQAvD_BwE%26gclsrc%3Daw.ds\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">TP-Link KIT WiFi Smart Plug, 2-Pack, available at Best Buy, $14.99</a></h3><p>Whether they're wondering if they turned off their hot iron or just don't want to get up to turn off the TV, a smart plug lets them control devices from a distance. You can connect to them using any smart device.</p>\n\tA great Alexa-enabled speaker they can control by voice\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cc310a17456537b135a0b26?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Sonos One\" height=\"783\" width=\"1045\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sonos</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.sonos.com/en-us/shop/one.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Sonos One Smart Speaker, available at Sonos, from $199</a></h3><p>The new Sonos One smart speaker fills any room with clear, rich sound, and they can use Alexa to play and control their music without ever lifting a finger. Find&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sonos-one-voice-controlled-smart-speaker-review-2017-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a full review here</a>.</p>\n\tA waterproof e-reader with a no-glare screen\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cc310f64a16757db86aca03?format=jpeg\" alt=\"5ba275d25c5e520b308b617d 960 720\" height=\"720\" width=\"960\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Famazon-kindle-paperwhite-e-reader-with-special-offers-6-8gb-black%2F6306574.p%3FskuId%3D6306574%26ref%3D212%26loc%3D1%26ref%3D212%26loc%3DBM01%26gclid%3DCjwKCAjw3-bzBRBhEiwAgnnLCujH3mtrFUobOryQKy-bU0BHY_5vC6f9mnpEj0HEY3-q90dsnPtMhhoC2TcQAvD_BwE%26gclsrc%3Daw.ds\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">All-New Kindle Paperwhite, available at Best Buy, $129.99</a></h3><p>Amazon's all-new Kindle Paperwhite is the thinnest, lightest one yet and it's waterproof for reading anywhere, including the beach or bath. It also has double the storage, a built-in light that adjusts to accommodate reading indoors or outdoors, day and night. Plus, a single battery charge lasts weeks rather than hours.</p>\n\tGift cards for concert tickets, food, and clothes\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cc31188b14bf47c697d9fc7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"5b8062f8dcee305c298b4982 750 563\" height=\"563\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chipotle</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<section data-slideshow-inner-content=\"\"><p>You can't go wrong with money for their favorite things, especially for teens who are often relying upon part-time jobs to fund their frequent Chipotle meals and concert trips with friends. eecb08306a5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ccXpgF-9GuA:_y-bt9Glemg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn87@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-44-661_eda4af8f4379232e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ccXpgF-9GuA:_y-bt9Glemg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-37-042_12e3b130dbf634f0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ccXpgF-9GuA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn34@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-53-185_910dd04b8c81330c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490774},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"Trump, making false claims about mail-in ballots, suggests counting votes could lead to 'violence in the streets'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-suggests-counting-votes-could-lead-to-violence-in-streets-2020-11","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa0ccbe69331a0011bc6e48?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 1229133238\" height=\"1647\" width=\"2197\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   A voter casts his early voting ballot at drop box outside of City Hall on October 17, 2020 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Mark Makela/Getty Images</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\"> \n <li>President Trump made more false claims about mail-in voting on Monday, leading <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-trump-tweet-supreme-court-pennsylvania-mail-in-ballots-misleading-2020-11\">Twitter to label one of his posts as potentially \"misleading.\"</a></li> \n <li>Trump was particularly incensed by the US Supreme Court's decision not to hear a Republican challenge regarding mail-in votes in Pennsylvania.</li> \n <li>Pennsylvania election officials will count ballots that are received up to 72 hours after Nov. 3, so long as there is no evidence they were cast after Election Day.</li> \n <li>Trump suggested counting such votes would lead to \"violence in the streets.\"</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li> \n</ul>\n<p>President Trump is pinning his hopes in the commonwealth of Pennsylvania on preventing all votes that are cast from actually being counted, with his latest dubious attack on mail-in voting <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-trump-tweet-supreme-court-pennsylvania-mail-in-ballots-misleading-2020-11\">flagged by Twitter on Monday as potentially \"misleading.\"</a></p>\n<p>In 2016, Trump won Pennsylvania by less than 45,000 votes. This time around, however, former Vice President Joe Biden has been leading the polls there ever since he won the Democratic nomination — on the eve of the election, he's up by an <a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/pennsylvania/\">average of 4.9%</a>.</p>\n<p>Because of the pandemic, all Pennsylvanians are eligible to cast their vote by mail. But registered Democrats are far more likely to do so — <a href=\"https://electproject.github.io/Early-Vote-2020G/PA.html\">only 25%</a> of mail-in ballots were requested by registered Republicans — which could be in part because of unsubstantiated claims made by the president. The latest: that counting these votes, up to three days after the election itself, \"<a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1323430341512622080\">will allow rampant and unchecked cheating.</a>\"</p>\n<p>The president repeated that lie in person.</p>\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">\n —Sam Levine (@srl) \n <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1323459357015707649?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 3, 2020</a>\n</blockquote>\n<script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script>\n<p>Neither Trump nor his allies have ever provided a coherent explanation for how counting ballots could enable fraud, or why Democrats, if they were capable of stealing an election, would rely on ballots received after Election Day that are already subject to litigation. What they have done is explain that challenging the legitimacy of Americans' votes — stopping them from being counted — is central to their strategy.</p>\n<p>As Axios <a href=\"https://www.axios.com/trump-claim-election-victory-ballots-97eb12b9-5e35-402f-9ea3-0ccfb47f613f.html?utm_source=twitter&amp;utm_medium=social&amp;utm_campaign=organic&amp;utm_content=1100content=1100\">reported on Sunday</a>, three aides to the president have said he plans to claim \"victory\" on Tuesday night even if votes are not done being counted in bellwether states like Pennsylvania. Accordingly, \"Trump's team is preparing to falsely claim that mail-in ballots counted after Nov. 3 — a legitimate count expected to favor Democrats — are evidence of election fraud.\"</p>\n<p>However, Pennsylvania Secretary of State Kathy Boockvar <a href=\"https://www.axios.com/pennsylvania-elections-boockvar-night-calling-26c50dd8-54d6-4b20-aff7-c95bed472aba.html\">explained on</a> NBC's Meet the Press, \"elections have never been called on election night\"; it is news organizations, not state governments, that call winners and losers, the day of, based on exit polls and statistical probabilities.</p>\n<p>Last month, Pennsylvania's highest court upheld a policy of counting mail-ballots that arrive up until Nov. 6, so long as there is no evidence they were cast after Election Day. The US Supreme Court this week <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-virus-outbreak-campaigns-local-elections-pennsylvania-355f8dca7a34a4902f42d8f4931c419e\">decided not to hear</a> a Republican challenge to that ruling, for now deciding not to penalize voters for delays in mail delivery; it could revisit the issue pending future litigation.</p>\n<p>On Twitter, Trump called that non-decision \"dangerous,\" adding another claim about mail-in voting that sounded more like incitement: \"It will also induce violence in the streets.\" In-person, he repeated what appeared to be a threat: \"There's a lot of bad things that can happen with the streets. You're going to have a population that's going to be very angry.\"</p>\n<p>It is unlikely, albeit not impossible, that it will come to that. As of Nov. 1, 82% of Democrats who requested mail-in ballots have already returned them. The 2.4 million ballots returned overall is also equal to just under 40% of all votes cast in 2016.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>If Trump loses Pennsylvania, odds are he's already lost it.</p>\n<p><em>Have a news tip? Email this reporter: </em><a href=\"mailto:cdavis@insider.com\"><em>cdavis@insider.com</em></a></p>\n<div class=\"read-original\">\n Read the original article on \n <a Davis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fa0ccbe69331a0011bc6e48?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn23@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-31-279_7f2d2d39398cca8b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=dbPEPQ7s35o:Sw9Khy9gxz0:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn34@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-37-127_e24e5404cf06675b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=dbPEPQ7s35o:Sw9Khy9gxz0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn93@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-54-325_a0c0338122476b82.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=dbPEPQ7s35o:Sw9Khy9gxz0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn82@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-36-670_d40eecc448cb6d21.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/dbPEPQ7s35o":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn24@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-38-745_c1dfa17852ab0079.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490455},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"A CFP is an advisor armed with extensive education and ethical standards to help you manage your money","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-a-cfp-certified-financial-planner","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa0672669331a0011bc6cf6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cfp\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Certified Financial Planners (CFPs) must have considerable financial expertise, both academic and practical, and agree to always put clients&#39; interests before their own.\n<p class=\"copyright\">baona/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A Certified Financial Planner (CFP) is a trade-industry designation for advisors and other professionals in the financial field.&#160;</li>\n<li>To gain the CFP credential, planners must have a certain amount of experience, pass a rigorous exam, and commit to ongoing financial education.</li>\n<li>While not a legal license, the CFP indicates that a planner will bring a higher level of financial expertise and ethical behavior to their advice and management of a client's finances and investments.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\"><strong>Visit I</strong><strong>nsider's Investing reference</strong><strong>&#160;library for more stories</strong><strong>.</strong></a></li>\n</ul><p>When you're seeking advice on money matters, navigating the waters of wealth managers, financial planners, and other advisors can be downright confusing. Who should you trust in a field that's largely unregulated, but chock full of professionals with an alphabet soup of initials after their names?&#160;</p><p>\"CFP,\" which stands for Certified Financial Planner, is one of the most common and respected types of financial advisor you'll come across. Generally speaking, individuals designated as CFPs hold some of the strictest certifications for financial planning, as established by <a href=\"https://www.cfp.net/\">the CFP Board</a>, the nonprofit trade organization that aims to set the bar for trust, ethics, and expertise within the financial planning industry.&#160;</p><p>The CFP Board believes that \"every single American deserves competent and ethical financial advice from qualified professionals who are required to act as fiduciaries,\" says CFP Board CEO <a href=\"https://www.cfp.net/about-cfp-board/leadership-and-staff/kevin-r-keller\">Kevin R. Keller</a>, adding that the organization's role is \"to set and uphold the Certified Financial Planner certification for more than 87,000 professionals in the United States. We exist, in part, to set standards that go further than the minimum requirements of the law, for the benefit of the public and the profession.\"</p><p>Wondering if hiring a CFP is right for you? Here's everything you need to know about them.</p><h2>What is a Certified Financial Planner (CFP)?</h2><p>First, it's important to understand what a CFP is not. Unlike the CPA (certified public accountant), the CFP is not a state-sanctioned license to practice. Nor does it indicate registration with a federal or federal-sanctioned agency, like the <a href=\"https://www.sec.gov/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SEC</a> or <a href=\"https://www.finra.org/#/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FINRA</a>, which oversees stockbrokers.&#160;</p><p>Instead, the CFP is a professional credential set and enforced by the CFP Board. It offers those in the financial industry the opportunity to develop their skills, specialize, and continue their education to earn and maintain a prestigious designation.</p><p>It's also important to understand the difference between the general term \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-does-a-financial-planner-do-guide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">financial planner</a>\" and the Certified Financial Planner designation. Anyone can hang out a shingle and call themselves a financial planner, but it takes a lot of time and effort to become a CFP.</p><h2>How to become a CFP</h2><p>Earning a CFP begins with education. Candidates must have a bachelor's or graduate degree from an accredited college or university.&#160;</p><p>They'll also complete additional CFP Board-approved coursework for certification at one of 200 educational institutions. These classes span 72 financial planning specialties, such as investments, retirement planning, risk management, insurance, taxes, and estate planning.</p><p>When ready, candidates have to pass an intensive exam asking them to apply their financial knowledge to real-life situations.&#160;</p><p>Additionally, they have to complete either 6,000 hours of unsupervised financial planning services to the public or 4,000 hours of apprenticeship work with a professional firm, either before or after taking the exam.&#160;</p><p>Finally, they will have to agree to and conduct business according to the CFP Board's ethical standards, which include acting as a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/what-is-a-fiduciary-financial-adviser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">fiduciary</a>.&#160;</p><p>Once they receive the CFP, they have to continue to meet annual requirements for ongoing certification.&#160;</p><h2>What do CFPs do?</h2><p>A good financial planner helps organize and offers guidance on every aspect of your financial life, including saving for <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/automate-retirement-savings-2019-5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">retirement </a>or college, guiding your investment strategies; planning for big shorter-term expenses, like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/buy-a-house-by-35-monthly-savings-math-2018-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">buying a house</a>; everyday <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-manage-your-money-expert-budgeting-tips\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">budgeting</a> and spending; tax strategies; insurance and estate planning.</p><p>\"A financial professional or financial planner is the person who asks you meaningful questions, allows you to answer, and then provides a framework for you to make decisions about your future,\" says Julie Genjac, Managing Director of Applied Insights at <a href=\"https://www.hartfordfunds.com/home.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hartford Funds</a>. \"They educate you and connect you to resources, even outside of your financial life. They are your impartial sounding board, and can share stories of others who have experienced similar situations.\"</p><p>Often, professionals in a related field choose to earn CFP certification in addition to their main practice. You'll find CPAs, attorneys, insurance agents, and other legal, financial, or business professionals with CFP certification.&#160;</p><p>Others work solely as financial planners, wealth management advisers, analysts, or investment and portfolio managers. They often actively help you to invest or buy products, such as mutual funds and insurance.</p><h2>How are CFPs different from other planners and advisors?</h2><p>What makes CFPs different is the education, ongoing certification requirements, and practical experience they have acquired. They are also held to a high standard of ethics and expected to act as a fiduciary for their clients — which means they are ethically bound to deliver advice and take action that is in the client's best interest — and will back up that promise in writing.&#160;</p><p>Not all financial professionals are held to these standards. Professionals working for brokerages and financial services companies, for example, are often held to a lesser \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/financial-planner-vs-financial-adviser\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">suitability standard</a>,\" which only mandates that they recommend appropriate products and strategies.</p><h2>How much do CFPs cost?</h2><p>Pay scales for CFPs vary. Some work on a commission basis, meaning they get a percentage of the investment and insurance products they sell you.&#160;</p><p>Fee-only financial planners generally charge an hourly rate or a retainer, which is usually a small percentage of the value of the assets they manage on your behalf. Some may have a fixed fee for specific services. <a href=\"https://www.kitces.com/blog/second-kitces-research-study-real-financial-planning-process-2020/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">According to a 2019 Kitces Research Study on Financial Planning</a>, the average professional charges $2,361 to create a client's written financial plan, for example.</p><p>You may also find planners that get compensated in a combination of ways: They charge fees for certain services and reap commissions for certain products. In fact, in 2019, the CFP Board changed guidance in its ethical standards to include fee-only, fee-and-commission, and commission-based compensation models.&#160;</p><p>Some feel the fee-only approach best fits with a planner's fiduciary ethos. Working on commission isn't necessarily a bad thing, though, as long as the planner is transparent about receiving them — and in what amount for which product or company. Those compensated via commission argue it keeps client costs down.&#160;</p><p>Working with a CFP may cost more than if you chose another type of financial advisor — not just because they tend to be fee-based, but because of the specialized education and increased experience CFPs offer.&#160;</p><h2>How do you find a CFP?</h2><p>Professionals who hold the credential use the CFP or CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER trademark as a way of identifying themselves, displaying it after their names. In addition:</p><ul><li>All CFPs are issued a certification number that can be verified through the <a href=\"https://www.cfp.net/verify-a-cfp-professional\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">CFP Board website</a>.&#160;</li><li>The CFP Board's consumer website, <a href=\"https://www.letsmakeaplan.org/choose-a-cfp-professional/find-a-cfp-professional?gclid=CjwKEAiA9om3BRDpzvihsdGnhTwSJAAkSewLIgB1GH95lrTy3VJcGVIZSW8HPzAjHhIrZIMoPLldXRoCt3Pw_wcB&gclid=CjwKEAiA9om3BRDpzvihsdGnhTwSJAAkSewLIgB1GH95lrTy3VJcGVIZSW8HPzAjHhIrZIMoPLldXRoCt3Pw_wcB_wcB\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">LetsMakeAPlan.org</a>, lets you locate actively practicing CFPs. You can search by geography, specialty, language, and other criteria.</li><li>The <a href=\"https://www.napfa.org/find-an-advisor\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">National Association of Personal Financial Advisers (NAPFA) website</a> also offers a tool that allows you to search for professionals based on geography. This group requires members to be fee-only planners.</li></ul><h2>The financial takeaway</h2><p>CFPs have to complete years of education, thousands of hours of practical experience, and ongoing adherence to high ethical standards and certification requirements. As fiduciaries, they are ethically bound to put their clients' financial interests above their own. They also take a holistic approach to financial planning, looking at both long-term and short-term goals.&#160;</p><p>That said, though CFPs are held to a high standard, non-CFP financial planners and advisers can also provide you with the same level of ethics and professionalism.&#160;</p><p>What's most important of all: whether or not you can really connect with your advisor. This is often a long-term relationship and one that deals with very personal matters. So you should feel comfortable with who they are and how they work with you, regardless of the letters that are trailing after their name.&#160;</p><h2>Related Coverage in&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">Investing</a>:</h2><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-does-a-financial-planner-do-guide\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What does a financial planner do? Help you manage your money, no matter how much you have</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-a-robo-advisor\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Robo-advisors offer automated investing services at a low cost — here's how to tell if they're right for you</a></h3><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li><h3><a (Robin Kavanagh)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fa0672669331a0011bc6cf6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn86@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-52-071_5e20f4e55a1af5b6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=wGEfbQdhXYQ:Rb238H-9sqw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn17@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-55-352_6f67d62af631843b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=wGEfbQdhXYQ:Rb238H-9sqw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn99@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-34-198_ce825736f45c1597.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=wGEfbQdhXYQ:Rb238H-9sqw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn22@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-55-206_1eeb3a36642088cc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/wGEfbQdhXYQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn22@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-46-203_25ff9da35bae6c99.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490505},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"The 'sausage king' of Russia was killed with a crossbow on his own estate","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/sausage-king-of-russia-killed-with-crossbow-at-his-estate-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa06ca169331a0011bc6d1a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 127544394\" height=\"3933\" width=\"5245\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Vladimir Marugov owned major sausage factories in Russia.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Monty Rakusen/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Russian businessman Vladimir Marugov was killed by a crossbow in the sauna of his own estate, <a href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-54782634\">the BBC reports</a>.</li>\n<li>Marugov, who owns two major sausages factories and is known as the \"Sausage King,\" was sitting at an outdoor sauna with his partner when two masked assailants struck.</li>\n<li>The assailants reportedly demanded money from Marugov; his body was later found with a crossbow next to it. His partner was able to escape through a window and contact authorities from a neighbor's house.</li>\n<li>The BBC referred to Marugov as an \"oligarch,\" a term synonymous with modern Russia's extremely wealthy, and increasingly with those who meet sudden and deadly ends.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A Russian businessman known as the \"Sausage King\" was killed with a crossbow at his countryside estate on Monday, <a href=\"https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2020/11/02/russias-sausage-king-murdered-with-crossbow-a71933\">according to The Moscow Times</a>.</p><p>Vladimir Marugov and his partner were sitting in an outdoor sauna when, <a href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-54782634\">according to the BBC</a>, two masked people attacked. They reportedly demanded money from Marugov, who owned the \"Meat Empire\" and \"Ozyorsky\" sausage factories.</p><p>The woman was able to successfully escape through the window and alert authorities from a neighbor's house, but not Marugov; his body was reportedly found with a crossbow next to it.</p><p>Per the BBC, Russia's Investigative Committee said the attack occurred early in the morning at Marugov's estate 25 miles outside of Moscow.</p><p>The assailants fled the scene in a getaway car, which was later discovered in Istra, a town outside of Moscow. A male suspect has reportedly been detained by police.</p><p>The Moscow Times reports that Marugov has been embroiled in a \"property rights conflict\" with ex-wife Tatyana Marugova since 2019; the duo had divorced about five years earlier.&#160;</p><p>The BBC identified Muragov as an \"oligarch,\" a term that in post-Soviet Russia came to refer to the new generation of billionaires who emerged amid the sudden privatisations of major industries during the 1990s. Many oligarchs, according to Russian President Vladimir Putin,&#160;<a href=\"https://theconversation.com/what-is-an-oligarch-126244\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://theconversation.com/what-is-an-oligarch-126244\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">\"use their proximity to the authorities to receive super profits,\"</a> but it is unclear if Muragov and his sausage business have any such connections.</p><p>In addition, many of Russia's oligarchs have met with grisly ends in recent years, such as&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/russian-boris-berezovsky-found-dead-2013-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/russian-boris-berezovsky-found-dead-2013-3\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Boris Berezovsky</a>&#160;in 2013,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nikolai-glushkov-murdered-exile-may-have-been-poisoned-before-2018-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nikolai-glushkov-murdered-exile-may-have-been-poisoned-before-2018-9\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Nikolai Glushkov</a>&#160;in 2018, and just last year,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/06/uk/dmitry-obretetskiy-russian-billionaire-uk-death-gbr-intl/index.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/06/uk/dmitry-obretetskiy-russian-billionaire-uk-death-gbr-intl/index.html\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Dmitry Obretskiy</a>. Also last year, in August, Marugov's son Alexander was killed in a motorcycle accident.&#160;</p><p>The rich have more generally been on edge about security concerns in recent years. As <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rich-people-spending-more-privacy-security-2018-11\">Business Insider's Hillary Hoffower reported</a>, some ultrawealthy individuals started prioritizing safety over flashiness and toned down displays of wealth.</p><p>\"Now, particularly with personal information readily available via internet and social-media sources, people are using what was once private information to learn where clients live — or information about their activities in order to seek personal encounters with them,\" Gary Howlin, the senior vice president of executive protection company Gavin de Becker &#38; Associates, told Hoffower.</p><p>And, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/luxury-panic-rooms-gun-violence-increased-demand-rich-people-2018-11\">as Business Insider's Katie Warren reported in 2018</a>, some super rich people had begun paying up to $500,000 for luxury panic rooms.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a scarf","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/luxury-gifts-for-her","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sign up for Insider Reviews' weekly newsletter for more buying advice and great deals</a></li></ul><p>Some gifting occasions warrant spending a little extra, whether it's a quality investment piece you know they'll enjoy for years to come or an upgraded take on an everyday item that makes it feel like a special treat.&#160;</p><p>If you're really looking to make an impression this holiday season, we've rounded up some of the best luxury gift ideas, from a pair of ultra-soft pajamas we personally swear by to a tech-heavy toothbrush that's packed full of features.</p><h2>The top 5 luxury gifts:</h2><ol><li><a inequality","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-outlook-morgan-stanley-slow-growth-inequality-economic-shift-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img January 22, 2007 in New York City.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by Spencer Platt/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>A \"tectonic shift\" in US macroeconomic policy that could cause increased capital investment and be bullish for sectors like financials and consumer durables may be up ahead, according to Morgan Stanley Wealth Management's Lisa Shalett.&#160;</strong></li></ul><ul><li><strong>The CIO said on Monday that a decade of slowing growth and rising wealth inequality has led some investors to begin to tolerate increased fiscal spending and higher inflation.&#160;</strong></li></ul><ul><li><strong>This new policy regime should produce \"fresh market leadership centered on capital investment, infrastructure, housing, and a leveraged consumer sector,\" said Shalett.&#160;</strong></li></ul><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestedium=ingest\"><strong>Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</strong></a><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>There's a major shift coming for stock markets that goes well beyond the usual business cycle reversal, Morgan Stanley is warning.&#160;</p><p>A decade of slowing secular growth and rising wealth inequality, paired with the failure of monetary policies to normalize growth is leading to a \"tectonic shift\" in US macroeconomic policy, the Morgan Stanley Wealth Management's chief investment officer Lisa Shalett said in a Monday note to clients.&#160;<br><br>\"With policy interest rates at the zero lower bound on fed funds and wealth/income inequality at levels not seen since the 1920s, investors are turning to Keynesian approaches to break the logjam of excess supply and savings chasing insufficient aggregate demand,\" Shalett said. <br><br>Those \"Keynesian\" approaches could come in the forms of tolerating increased spending from the government and tolerating higher inflation, said Shalett.</p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stocks-to-buy-and-avoid-in-3-election-outcomes-stifel-2020-10?r=gr-sub\" data-analytics-position=\"5\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Stifel asked its analysts to identify stocks most likely to be positively or negatively affected by the election results. Here are the dozens of stocks to buy or avoid in each of the 3 outcomes.</a></em></p><p>\"The new business cycle, combined with a vastly different policy regime, should produce fresh market leadership centered on capital investment, infrastructure, housing, and a leveraged consumer sector,\" she added.</p><p>Shalett said stock sectors that will benefit from this shift include financials, industrials, clean energy, construction, consumer durables, and service-sector automation.</p><p>This shift will occur soon because of the current levels of volatility in the stock market, she said. Volatility within the <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/vix-of-vix-index\">CBOE VIX volatility index</a> is at its third highest in five years. The last two times it reached these levels in recent times, Shalett said, structural change in the form of the Fed's reversal of monetary policy from tightening to easing, and the Covid-19-induced lockdowns happened. This time, the results could be even more pronounced.&#160;</p><p>\"We don't see recent market volatility as merely signaling a pause in the bull market related to temporary uncertainties, nor do we think it's an end-of-cycle repositioning that accompanies all recessions,\" Shalett said. \"Rather, we see market churning as a burgeoning recognition by investors of much more profound change in which government activism, spending and regulation are cheered by investors while debt, inflation and dollar debasement are acknowledged as necessary for economic normalization.\"</p><p>This profound shift means US Treasuries, the dollar, and overvalued long-duration assets are at risk.</p><p>\"Could the VIX volatility be signaling a structural shift or a shift in the business cycle?\" Shalett said. \"We think chances are decent of both, which is why we don't recommend sticking with yesterday's leaders.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Both figures stand 3 inches high and can be displayed and admired.</p><p><strong>Recommended ages:</strong> 10 years and up</p>\n\tAn excavation kit\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9456adf21803001222bc87?format=jpeg\" alt=\"national_geographic_mega_fossil_gemstone_dig_kit\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B084RNFX5N/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_102720_best-kids-gifts-toys-roundup-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B084RNFX5N&#38;linkId=fc6e6b5a236d7b1fcd71d3dada516f91\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">National Geographic Mega Fossil and Gemstone Dig Kits, available at Amazon, $24.99</a></h3><p>Budding geologists can excavate 20 genuine gemstones and fossils from a dig brick. r.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=CacMtw-drk4:cqSwLlR-9iU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn20@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-47-554_1e406a6037351fd7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/CacMtw-drk4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn41@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-46-327_c97124c9fb732475.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490642},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"Dow jumps 423 points in rebound from worst week since March","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-news-today-ism-economic-data-earnings-election-volatility-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f401f2842f43f001ddfe6d2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Happy trader\" height=\"1499\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mario Tama/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>US stocks rallied on Monday as encouraging economic data and election bets lifted indexes from <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-news-today-megacap-tech-outlook-wost-week-march-2020-10-1029747919\">their worst weekly slump since March</a>.</strong></li><li><strong>Market volatility picked up as Election Day neared. Former Vice President Joe Biden has enjoyed a lead in the polls, but President Donald Trump has indicated he would contest a close election through legal battles in swing states.</strong></li><li><strong>A closely watched gauge of US manufacturing-industry growth climbed at its fastest rate in two years. The index gained to 59.3 in October from 55.4, beating economists' estimates of 56.</strong></li><li><strong>Oil rebounded slightly from five-month lows, with <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?type=wti\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">West Texas Intermediate crude</a> jumping as much as 3.6%, to $37.09 per barrel.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/indices\">Watch major indexes update live here</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>US stocks jumped on Monday as investors cheered better-than-expected economic data and braced for the US presidential election on Tuesday.</p><p>Energy, industrial, and materials stocks led the market's upswing from its <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-news-today-megacap-tech-outlook-wost-week-march-2020-10-1029747919\">worst week since March</a>. Tech stocks hobbled to a meager one-day gain as investors continued to shun disappointing earnings results from mega-cap names.</p><p>Cboe's <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/vix\">VIX</a> index — Wall Street's preferred gauge of market volatility — fluctuated at slightly elevated levels as investors finalized their Election Day strategies. The results, particularly in Senate races, could determine whether fiscal stimulus is enacted early next year.</p><p>While former Vice President Joe Biden has enjoyed a lead in the polls, President Donald Trump could pull off the same kind of surprise victory as he did four years ago. Any contested results and legal battles would almost surely fuel choppy price action and further volatility.</p><p><strong>Here's where US indexes stood at the close on Monday:</strong></p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">S&#38;P 500</a>:</strong> 3,310.24, up 1.23%</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestmp;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dow Jones industrial average</a>:</strong> 26,925.05, up 1.6% (423 points)</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/nasdaq_composite?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestmp;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nasdaq composite</a>:</strong> 10,957.61, up 0.42%</li></ul><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/house-flipping-real-estate-investing-steven-pesavento-shares-strategy-2020-10?r=gr-sub\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Steven Pesavento quit his 9-to-5 career to pursue real-estate investing full time. Here's how he went from a no-experience tech-head to having flipped over 200 properties in a few years' time.</a></em></p><p>\"With one day to go until the presidential election, the stock market will undoubtedly take a wait and see attitude, with traders apprehensive about disputed election results,\" said Marc Chaikin, the founder of the quantitative research firm Chaikin Analytics.</p><p>The first major economic-data release of the month supported arguments that the US recovery remains strong. The Institute for Supply Management's gauge of manufacturing activity jumped to 59.3 in October from 55.4, its fastest rate of expansion since 2018. Readings above 50 indicate industry growth. Economists surveyed by Bloomberg had expected the gauge to reach 56.</p><p>\"Manufacturing's recovery is much more advanced than services, but we expect factory activity to face challenges from the slowing domestic recovery and weaker external demand without the crutch of generous fiscal support,\" Oren Klachkin, the lead US economist at Oxford Economics, said in a note.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/election-investing-advice-assets-not-pricing-democratic-sweep-andrew-sheets-2020-11\" data-analytics-position=\"9\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Morgan Stanley's top cross-asset strategist says 3 assets are not pricing in a Democratic sweep — setting them up for big gains if that scenario unfolds</a></em></p><aside data-state=\"ready\"></aside><p>As if US elections weren't enough for investors, the Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee is set to meet on Wednesday and Thursday to further discuss its policy response to the coronavirus recession. The group is largely expected to keep interest rates at historic lows. Federal Reserve officials have hinted that the central bank could increase its pace of asset purchases from $120 billion a month to further support the economic recovery.</p><p>More than 74,000 new COVID-19 cases were reported in the US on Sunday, and the US death toll passed 230,000 over the weekend. With England joining Germany and France in instituting partial lockdowns, some fear the US will take similar steps to prevent the virus' spread.</p><p>Monday's gains retraced some of last week's hefty losses. Markets tanked through the end of October as soaring COVID-19 cases and disappointing tech earnings prompted sell-offs. The Dow sat mired in correction territory, while the S&#38;P 500 and the Nasdaq followed close behind.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/election-investing-advice-assets-not-pricing-democratic-sweep-andrew-sheets-2020-11?r=gr-sub\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Morgan Stanley's top cross-asset strategist says these 3 assets are not pricing in a Democratic sweep — setting them up for big gains if that scenario unfolds</a></em></p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/dnkn-stock\">Dunkin' Brands</a> surged after agreeing to an $11.3 billion acquisition by Inspire Brands. The deal — among the biggest in the restaurant industry — would take Dunkin' private at $106.50 per share, a 20% premium from its October 23 closing price.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/nio-stock-price-record-doubles-car-deliveries-in-october-2020-11-1029753837\">Nio surged to record highs</a> after the automaker announced it doubled its October vehicle deliveries, to 5,055.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/pypl-stock\">PayPal</a>, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/expe-stock\">Expedia</a>, and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/mdlz-stock\">Mondelez</a> are set to report earnings after the closing bell.</p><p>Bitcoin surged as high as $13,877.48 on Sunday before hovering at about $13,400 on Monday morning. The weekend rally reignited momentum that faded through last week's gloomy sessions.</p><p>Spot gold gained as much as 0.9%, to $1,895.41 per ounce. The US dollar gained against a basket of peer currencies, and Treasury yields dipped.</p><p>Oil futures rebounded after touching five-month lows earlier in the day. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?type=wti\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">West Texas Intermediate crude</a> jumped as much as 3.6%, to $37.09 per barrel. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestarkets&#38;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Brent crude</a>, oil's international standard, surged 4.9%, to $39.28 per barrel, at intraday highs.</p><p><em><strong>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a data-analytics-module=\"\">Stocks face a tougher climb in 2021 due to 'inevitable hangover of policy,' top Wall Street strategist says</a><br></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a reelection","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/only-2-major-us-newspapers-have-endorsed-trump-for-reelection-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f904395d25aab0018402c78?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages donald trump\" height=\"512\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Caitlin O&#39;Hara/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President Donald Trump has received only six endorsements from major newspapers for his reelection, as of Nov 2.</li>\n<li>Meanwhile, more than 40 news outlets have endorsed Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden.</li>\n<li>Newspaper endorsements have historically helped undecided voters choose a candidate.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Only six major American newspapers have endorsed President Donald Trump for reelection, far below the dozens of publications that have announced their support for Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden.</p><p>The major outlets in favor of Trump are the <a href=\"https://www.reviewjournal.com/opinion/rj-endorses/review-journal-endorsement-president-of-the-united-states-2137028/\">Las Vegas Review-Journal,</a>&#160;<a href=\"https://nypost.com/2020/10/26/the-new-york-post-endorses-president-donald-j-trump-for-re-election/\">New York Post,</a> <a href=\"https://gazette.com/premium/endorsement-colorado-should-vote-for-president-donald-trump/article_6797ea56-1572-11eb-a4fa-0b36a583333a.html\">Colorado Springs Gazette</a>, <a href=\"https://www.spokesman.com/stories/2020/oct/25/editorial-trump-for-president-inslee-for-governor/\">The Spokesman Review,</a>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.bostonherald.com/2020/10/27/the-herald-endorses-president-trump/\">Boston Herald&#160;</a>and the <a href=\"https://www.post-gazette.com/opinion/editorials/2020/10/31/editorial-donald-trump-joe-biden-mike-pence-kamala-harris-presidential-candidate-endorsement/stories/202010310021\">Pittsburgh Post-Gazette.</a></p><p>\"For all his flaws, Donald J. Trump stands in forceful contrast to the relentless progressive attacks on this nation that deny and minimize the advances we have made over the decades to better reflect and honor our founding ideals,\" the Las Vegas Review-Journal's editorial board wrote. \"He deserves a second term.\"</p><p>The Las Vegas Review-Journal — owned by billionaire Sheldon Adelson, a GOP mega-donor and casino magnate who has <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/15/politics/sheldon-adelson-funds-trump-super-pac/index.html\">poured millions</a> into Trump's reelection effort — had also endorsed Trump back in 2016. The New York Post hadn't, although it endorsed Trump in the 2016 Republican primaries. The Colorado Springs Gazette and Boston Herald did not endorse any candidate in 2016 and The Spokesman Review went for Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton. Trump is the first Republican presidential candidate the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette has supported since 1972.</p><p>\"Donald Trump is a bully and a bigot,\" The Spokesman Review's editorial board wrote in their 2020 endorsement. \"We recommend voting for him anyway because the policies that Joe Biden and his progressive supporters would impose on the nation would be worse.\"</p><p>The University of California Santa Barbara <a href=\"https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/statistics/data/2020-general-election-editorial-endorsements-major-newspapers\">tracks</a> major newspaper endorsements, which it defines as the largest 100 newspapers by circulation. UCSB's American Presidency Project also cited an editorial by the Arkansas Democrat Gazette as a Trump endorsement, but its publisher told Insider that the paper declined to explicitly endorse either candidate.</p><p>Nonetheless, <a href=\"https://www.arkansasonline.com/news/2020/oct/18/editorial-think-hard-about-the-top-of-the-ticket/\">the editorial</a> raised many questions about Biden and offered reasons to support Trump. It concludes: \"If Biden wins and the Democrats take the Senate and end the filibuster rule--and along with a Democratic House pass much of the radical far left agenda--will Biden really veto it? We doubt it. A vote for Trump instead of Biden might be the best check on that becoming a reality in America.\"</p><p>Trump's lack of major newspaper endorsements is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-endorsements-newspaper-editorial-board-president-2016-10\">in line</a> with his 2016 campaign, which was an unprecedented low for a major party nominee. An <a href=\"https://thehill.com/blogs/ballot-box/presidential-races/304606-final-newspaper-endorsement-count-clinton-57-trump-2\">overwhelming chunk</a> of newspapers backed Clinton.&#160;</p><p>By this stage in the election cycle, <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/tommybeer/2020/09/20/poll-finds-11-of-voters-still-undecided-as-election-nears/#2d9d28442eed\">most</a> <a href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2020/10/18/donald-trumps-toughest-hurdle-2020-election-win-few-undecideds/3654305001/\">voters</a> have already made up their mind on who they'll tick at the ballot box. Whether newspaper endorsements impact electoral outcomes remains up for debate, but they've typically been made to help nudge those who are still undecided toward a candidate. Historically, newspapers tended to favor Republican nominees, though in recent decades <a href=\"https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/political-newspaper-endorsements-history-and-outcome/\">the numbers have balanced out</a>.</p><p>Though most editorial boards have already stood by Biden, who's gained <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/major-news-outlets-endorse-joe-biden-for-president-2020-10\">more than 40 major endorsements thus far</a>. His support comes from a slew of major city newspapers as well as national outlets including The New York Times, USA Today, and The Washington Post.&#160;</p><p><em><strong>Correction</strong>: A previous version of this article said that the Arkansas Democrat Gazette endorsed President Donald Trump. Its editorial cited many reasons to support Trump and oppose Biden, but it did not endorse the president.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/only-2-major-us-newspapers-have-endorsed-trump-for-reelection-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=d9Yr41E14pc:lXuB3hSWwuQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=d9Yr41E14pc:lXuB3hSWwuQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=d9Yr41E14pc:lXuB3hSWwuQ:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=d9Yr41E14pc:lXuB3hSWwuQ:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=d9Yr41E14pc:lXuB3hSWwuQ:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=d9Yr41E14pc:lXuB3hSWwuQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=d9Yr41E14pc:lXuB3hSWwuQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/d9Yr41E14pc\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 02 Nov 2020 22:59:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8f175b0b19090019224579?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"12f77910a3dca003acdd99a6443d6f64","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn62@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-35-513_ab1a576780c2ae64.webp","destWidth":910,"destHeight":683,"sourceBytes":24224,"destBytes":24224,"author":"oseddiq@insider.com (Oma Seddiq)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f904395d25aab0018402c78?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn31@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-42-682_c78d2564ed4c795b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=d9Yr41E14pc:lXuB3hSWwuQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn35@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-53-874_66138d882ca181ea.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=d9Yr41E14pc:lXuB3hSWwuQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=d9Yr41E14pc:lXuB3hSWwuQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn2@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-58-558_88b1ba673458fc4c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/d9Yr41E14pc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn26@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-57-884_92d469fb5de97c3a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490456},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"'Biden can fix this mess': Dozens of major news outlets have endorsed Joe Biden for president","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/major-news-outlets-endorse-joe-biden-for-president-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8f01b0c21cfb001946901c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages joe biden\" height=\"683\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Drew Angerer/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden has received dozens of endorsements from news outlets.</li>\n<li>President Donald Trump, however, clinched the backing of only six major newspapers.</li>\n<li>Such endorsements have typically been made to help undecided voters choose a candidate.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Media endorsements are pouring in for Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden, with the election one day away.</p><p>Some major publications, including USA Today and Scientific American, broke with decades-long traditions to give their nods to the former vice president.&#160;</p><p>The outlets join more than 40 newspapers across the nation that have backed Biden as of November 2. The University of California Santa Barbara <a href=\"https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/statistics/data/2020-general-election-editorial-endorsements-major-newspapers\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"edc980e5ccc876db497dd32168fd4f3c\">tracks</a> major newspaper endorsements, which it defines as the largest 100 newspapers by circulation. Biden is also receiving a growing number of magazine endorsements.&#160;</p><p>By this stage in the election cycle, <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/tommybeer/2020/09/20/poll-finds-11-of-voters-still-undecided-as-election-nears/#2d9d28442eed\">most</a> <a href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2020/10/18/donald-trumps-toughest-hurdle-2020-election-win-few-undecideds/3654305001/\">voters</a> have already made up their minds about whose name they'll select at the ballot box. Whether newspaper endorsements impact electoral outcomes remains up for debate, but they've typically been made to help nudge those who are still undecided toward a candidate.&#160;</p><p>In 2016, a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hillary-clinton-endorsements-newspaper-editorial-board-president-2016-2016-9\">majority of news outlets</a> endorsed Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton while only two major newspapers supported Trump, signaling editorial boards didn't have a major impact on the election outcome.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/only-2-major-us-newspapers-have-endorsed-trump-for-reelection-2020-10\">number of major newspaper endorsements</a> that Trump has picked up this year remains low. This election cycle, he's been backed by the <a href=\"https://www.reviewjournal.com/opinion/rj-endorses/review-journal-endorsement-president-of-the-united-states-2137028/\">Las Vegas Review-Journal, </a><a href=\"https://nypost.com/2020/10/26/the-new-york-post-endorses-president-donald-j-trump-for-re-election/\">New York Post</a><a href=\"https://www.reviewjournal.com/opinion/rj-endorses/review-journal-endorsement-president-of-the-united-states-2137028/\"></a>, <a href=\"https://gazette.com/premium/endorsement-colorado-should-vote-for-president-donald-trump/article_6797ea56-1572-11eb-a4fa-0b36a583333a.html\">Colorado Springs Gazette,</a>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.spokesman.com/stories/2020/oct/25/editorial-trump-for-president-inslee-for-governor/\">The Spokesman Review,</a>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.bostonherald.com/2020/10/27/the-herald-endorses-president-trump/\">Boston Herald</a> and&#160;the&#160;<a href=\"https://www.post-gazette.com/opinion/editorials/2020/10/31/editorial-donald-trump-joe-biden-mike-pence-kamala-harris-presidential-candidate-endorsement/stories/202010310021\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"04f426e861ad0f8c85e3c0ce1fbc6d56\">Pittsburgh Post-Gazette.</a></p><h3>Here are some of Biden's major endorsements:</h3><ul><li>\"Biden is a worthy antidote to Trump's unbounded narcissism and chronic chaos.\" <a href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/in-depth/opinion/todaysdebate/2020/10/20/elect-joe-biden-reject-donald-trump-editorials-debates/5919435002/\">— USA Today</a></li><li>\"Mr. Biden is almost uniquely positioned for the moment. He would restore decency, honor and competence to America's government.\" <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2020/09/28/editorial-board-endorsement-joe-biden/?arc404=true\">— The Washington Post</a></li><li>\"Joe Biden has vowed to be a president for all Americans, even those who do not support him.\" <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/06/opinion/joe-biden-2020-nytimes-endorsement.html\">— The New York Times</a></li><li>\"Trump's record easily justifies a position of 'Anybody but Trump.' But Biden isn't just preferable to Trump; in many respects he is Trump's antithesis.\" <a href=\"https://www.latimes.com/opinion/story/2020-09-10/biden-president-election-2020-los-angeles-times-endorsement\">— Los Angeles Times</a>&#160;</li><li>\"We suffer no delusions: Trump has on his side demagogic skill and ruthlessness, a willingness to break any norm or law in order to win. Nevertheless, we hope that Biden will displace him by a margin that prevents prolonged dispute or the kind of civil unrest that Trump appears to relish.\" <a href=\"https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2020-endorsement\">— The New Yorker</a></li><li>\"Scientific American has never endorsed a presidential candidate in its 175-year history. This year we are compelled to do so. We do not do this lightly. The evidence and the science show that Donald Trump has badly damaged the U.S. and its people—because he rejects evidence and science.\" <a href=\"https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/scientific-american-endorses-joe-biden1/\">— Scientific American</a></li><li>\"The 2020 election, then, offers the nation a chance to reboot and rebuild from the racist, authoritarian, know-nothing wreckage wrought by the 45th president. And there are few Americans better suited to the challenge than Joe Biden.\" <a href=\"https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-news/joe-biden-president-endorsement-1074513/\">— Rolling Stone</a></li><li>\"Two men are running for president. One is a terrible man; the other is a decent man. Vote for the decent man.\" <a href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2020/10/atlantics-endorsement-against-donald-trump/616815/\">— The Atlantic</a></li><li>\"The fact that Biden is not an ideological firebrand, and is thought unlikely to pursue reelection in 2024 if he wins this November, augurs well for the central challenge that will confront the next president: how to repair the damage from Trump's four years.\" <a href=\"https://apps.bostonglobe.com/opinion/graphics/2020/10/biden-endorsement/\">— The Boston Globe</a></li><li>\"By endorsing Joe Biden, we are emphasizing that there is value in electing a president of the United States who does not engage with others with petulance. There is value in electing a president who does not insult, mock or demean. Our country can and must do better.\" <a href=\"https://www.chicagotribune.com/opinion/editorials/ct-edit-chicago-tribune-biden-endorsement-20200925-lnyxsb5qvrftnjjmj3rnzj33jy-story.html\">— Chicago Tribune</a></li><li>\"Biden can fix this mess.\" <a href=\"https://www.seattletimes.com/opinion/editorials/editorial-the-times-editorial-board-recommends-joe-biden-for-president/\">— The Seattle Times&#160;</a></li><li>\"This election is a test of whether we still embrace the concept of 'American exceptionalism,' that the virtue of our values, our political system and our history remain so distinct, so worthy, so enduring that we are a role model for the world.\" <a href=\"https://www.sfchronicle.com/opinion/editorials/article/Chronicle-recommends-Joe-Biden-for-president-15613880.php\">— San Francisco Chronicle</a></li><li>\"Donald Trump's despicable behavior and embarrassing record is not why The San Diego Union-Tribune Editorial Board today offers its enthusiastic endorsement of Democrat Joe Biden for president. We do so because Biden in important ways is the right person for the moment.\"&#160;<a href=\"https://www.sandiegouniontribune.com/opinion/editorials/story/2020-10-02/joe-biden-endorsement-for-president-san-diego-union-tribune-editorial-board\">— The San Diego Union-Tribune</a></li><li>\"America can overcome the damage Donald Trump has wrought in the last four years — and Joe Biden and Kamala Harris are the ones to lead the recovery.\" <a href=\"https://www.inquirer.com/opinion/editorials/a/philadelphia-inquirer-2020-endorsements-biden-trump-20201011.html\">— The Philadelphia Inquirer</a></li><li>\"Trump's deficiencies of decency are not a matter of style. These days, they are a matter of life and death.\" <a href=\"https://www.houstonchronicle.com/opinion/editorials/article/endorsement-Joe-Biden-president-us-election-2020-15636598.php\">— Houston Chronicle</a></li><li>Biden is \"the only responsible choice, in fact, for voters who wish to see this country's 244-year-old experiment in government by, for and of the people continue.\" <a href=\"https://www.freep.com/story/opinion/editorials/2020/09/20/detroit-free-press-presidential-endorsement-joe-biden-trump/5796299002/\">— Detroit Free Press</a></li><li>\"The nation cannot afford four more years of him. It needs the Biden-Harris ticket to make things right.\" <a href=\"https://www.sun-sentinel.com/opinion/endorsements/fl-op-general-endorse-joe-biden-president-20200827-jfla4dpm55g7vksh4n2c2vlo5a-story.html\">— The South Florida Sun Sentinel</a></li><li>\"Biden promises needed change. The alternative could be perilous for our democracy.\" <a href=\"https://www.tampabay.com/opinion/2020/10/08/a-clear-choice-for-president-the-times-editorial-board-recommendation/\">— Tampa Bay Times</a></li><li>\"America needs Joe Biden.\" <a href=\"https://www.newsday.com/opinion/editorial/2020-presidential-election-joe-biden-newsday-opinion-1.50032702\">— Newsday</a></li><li>\"Anyone who cares about the country must this year vote for Biden, a good and able man who can put America on a path back toward sanity.\" <a href=\"https://buffalonews.com/opinion/editorial/the-editorial-board-biden-for-president/article_c9004ed4-0f1c-11eb-91f0-73be11d651ea.html\">— The Buffalo News</a></li></ul><div
