border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/mYs7CI3PaAk\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 03 Nov 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f99dbb669331a0011bc5e94?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"9d6857c27b8aad601bd2c14efaaeab38","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn45@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-34-241_54781916d4766c1c.webp","destWidth":5001,"destHeight":3750,"sourceBytes":73656,"destBytes":73656,"author":"gpanetta@businessinsider.com (Grace Panetta,Madison Hall)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f283b665af6cc11ed0805a6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn62@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-58-803_8371370c3ee884ba.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mYs7CI3PaAk:JOI_OQk7bSs:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn93@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-50-464_f1b6425cb170de83.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mYs7CI3PaAk:JOI_OQk7bSs:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn12@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-42-600_9b279261c5e4021b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mYs7CI3PaAk:JOI_OQk7bSs:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn92@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-49-296_809a9a5d1a10bae7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/mYs7CI3PaAk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn45@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-48-664_f9c37ca82e5614b7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490532},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"The best flashlights","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-flashlight","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>A high-quality flashlight offers a variety of beam modes, maintains its brightness, and has a long-lasting battery that's easy to recharge or switch out.</strong></li><li><strong>For this guide, we field-tested a variety of flashlights and included those that performed well over several hours, offer useful features that justify their price, and are designed to take a beating.</strong></li><li><strong>Our top pick, the </strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0813DJSPL/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B0813DJSPL&linkId=23ee4527cb583a358ec2692cd6e77ea3cb583a358ec2692cd6e77ea3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Wowtac A7 Tactical Flashlight</strong></a><strong>, passed our durability tests, performed well in terms of overall brightness, and was one of the most affordable options we looked at.</strong></li></ul><p>Everyone needs a good flashlight. Even if you don't camp, use one professionally, or spend much time outside at night, a bright, reliable flashlight is an essential part of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-emergency-kit\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">emergency preparedness</a> and is just plain handy to have around the house. If the power ever goes out, each family member should have access to a light to guide them to safety. Fortunately, these useful tools have come a long way in the last decade.</p><p>\"The transition many years ago from incandescent bulbs was a huge leap forward,\" Jake Keller, head training advisor for the <a href=\"http://mcsosar.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Multnomah County (Oregon) Sheriff's Office Search &#38; Rescue Team</a> told Business Insider. \"LED lights help extend battery life and durability and require fewer battery changes. The technology continues to improve, and now you're seeing things like low-level red lights incorporated into a normal light, as well as more rechargeable options.\"</p><p>Since LEDs dominate the industry of late and remain superior to older models, the flashlights featured in this guide are only of the LED variety. This isn't to say older models aren't still feasible options but when boiling it down to the best, LED wins in every category.&#160;</p><h2>How to shop for a flashlight</h2><p>When choosing a flashlight, there are a number of factors Keller recommends considering: \"In an everyday carry application, I look for something small that easily fits into a pocket. I'd sacrifice an adjustable focus and battery life in favor of something small, bright, and quick to use.\"</p><p>During my tests, I paid special attention to brightness, ease of use, and size, but since different users have diverse needs, I also looked at battery runtime and adjustable focus abilities. For instance, if you're on a hiking trip, you may not have easy access to a charging port and may not want the added weight of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-rechargeable-batteries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">extra batteries</a>. This is where a longer battery runtime comes in handy.</p><p>The following recommendations each performed well throughout my field tests and proved to have useful features and a durability rating that justify the sometimes high sticker price. At the end of this guide, I also included input on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-flashlight#what-else-was-considered-6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">other models I tested</a>, as well as a rundown of my <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-flashlight#how-we-test-7\">testing methodology</a>.</p><h2>Here are the best flashlights:</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best overall:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0813DJSPL/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B0813DJSPL&linkId=23ee4527cb583a358ec2692cd6e77ea3cb583a358ec2692cd6e77ea3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Wowtac A7 Tactical Flashlight</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best budget:</strong> <strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00F7PDK1O/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00F7PDK1O&linkId=b20b139eb933f27a2507931ce96afed0b933f27a2507931ce96afed0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Dorcy Floating Flashlight</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best dual-power:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1440274-REG/coast_20518_polysteel_600r_rechargeable_pure.html/BI/20673/KBID/15977/DFF/d10-v21-t1-x924614/SID/EZ\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Coast 600R Waterproof Flashlight</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best for long-term brightness:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07JLKWQBR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07JLKWQBR&linkId=6b648e01ec1f6bc30a2f5366b24de6fcec1f6bc30a2f5366b24de6fc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>ThruNite TC15 Ultra-Bright Flashlight</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best penlight:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00UP3TOEA/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00UP3TOEA&linkId=bf9b1093172d6f33c18d5707f538566c172d6f33c18d5707f538566c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Coast HP3R Penlight</strong></a></li></ul><p><em>Updated on 11/2/2020 by Rick Stella: Updated the sections on how to shop for a flashlight and our testing methodology, checked the availability of each recommended flashlight, and updated the prices and links where necessary.</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best flashlight overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2c5e412438173f5775c23e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Wowtac flashlight\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong>The </strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0813DJSPL/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0813DJSPL&#38;linkId=23ee4527cb583a358ec2692cd6e77ea3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Wowtac A7 Tactical Flashlight</strong></a><strong> is not only one of the most affordable lights we tested, but it's also one of the brightest and most durable.</strong></h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Very bright, five brightness modes plus strobe, IPX8 waterproof rating, long-lasting rechargeable Li-ion battery, fits easily into a pocket&#160;</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Uses an uncommon 18650 battery</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0813DJSPL/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0813DJSPL&#38;linkId=23ee4527cb583a358ec2692cd6e77ea3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Wowtac A7 Tactical Flashlight</a> was the clear winner in our tests, led by excellent results regarding our brightness tests. When fully charged, the light was the brightest of all of the flashlights we tested. But after 10 minutes on its Turbo mode, the lumens dropped dramatically. Still, after the 90-minute test period, the A7 was one of the brightest models.</p><p>The A7 has five brightness modes including a Firefly mode, which is its dimmest at a reported 0.5 lumens, and a battery runtime of 108 days. Turbo is the brightest and is meant for short periods of ultra-brightness. There's also a Strobe mode, which has a high lumen output.&#160;</p><p>I like that the mode switching button is separate from the on/off button. This lets you easily keep the light set to your favorite mode and not have to cycle through each time you turn it on. Also, the anodized aluminum body (AL 6061-T6) surrounding the on/off button is raised, which makes it difficult to accidentally turn the unit on while it's in a backpack or pant pocket. And, at 4.5 inches long and one inch in diameter, it's easy to stow.</p><p>The Wowtac A7 didn't exactly wow during the durability tests as the light went out during the drop test &#8212; though it did start working again once I picked it up. The light has an IPX8 waterproof rating, which proved accurate as it handled full submersion without any impact on its performance.&#160;</p><p>I'd have liked to see a more common battery used in the A7, too. Instead, it operates on a 18650 battery. But, the rechargeable Li-ion Wowtac brand battery that it comes with lasted 10 hours on top brightness. Plus, charging the device is simple with the included micro USB charging cord.</p>\n\tThe best budget flashlight\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa08a9e1df1d5001821875b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dorcy flashlight\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong>The </strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00F7PDK1O/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00F7PDK1O&#38;linkId=b20b139eb933f27a2507931ce96afed0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Dorcy Floating Flashlight</strong></a><strong> is an affordable option that performs surprisingly and is not only waterproof but can float, too.</strong></h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Affordable, easy-to-use, floats, waterproof, built-in carabiner, long-lasting battery with consistent brightness</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Only one brightness mode</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00F7PDK1O/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00F7PDK1O&#38;linkId=b20b139eb933f27a2507931ce96afed0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Dorcy Floating Flashlight</a> is one impressive flashlight that costs less than just $20. It's the only light in our tests that floats, and it can handle being submerged without malfunctioning &#8212; though we weren't able to track down an IP rating. The waterproof properties make the light ideal for boats, around the pool, or in other wet areas. Its hard-plastic body is also quite durable passing the drop test with ease.&#160;</p><p>However, at 6.5 inches long and 2.5 inches in diameter, it only fits in larger pockets but does have a clip on the end for easy attachment to your belt loop or a rope.</p><p>Another downside is that there's only one brightness setting, though it doesn't dim much over time. After 90 minutes, it was among the top four brightest flashlights in this guide. The Dorcy Floating Flashlight has a manufacturer-reported beam distance of 67 meters and runs on 3 common AA batteries, which are included. And, I found the batteries last for roughly 40 hours of continuous use.&#160;</p><p>The on/off button is designed to make it hard to accidentally turn it on when you toss it in a bag. This is important because an easily engage on/off button could kill the battery before you have a chance to use your flashlight &#8212; which is a major consideration for hikers and backpackers. The button even functioned well when I wore thick gloves.&#160;</p><p>I also put the flashlight on a 15-percent incline to see if it would roll away, a concern when doing work in uneven terrain. The rubber surrounding the lens kept the Dorcy light in place.</p>\n\tThe best dual power flashlight\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2c44a15af6cc385a1c6862?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Coast 600R\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong>The </strong><a href=\"https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1440274-REG/coast_20518_polysteel_600r_rechargeable_pure.html/BI/20673/KBID/15977/DFF/d10-v21-t1-x924614/SID/EZ\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Coast 600R Waterproof Flashlight</strong></a><strong> produces a strong beam of light with adjustable focus whether you operate it using the rechargeable battery or alkaline batteries.</strong></h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Operates using either rechargeable or 4 AA batteries, excellent performance in our brightness and durability tests, IPX8 waterproof rating, easy to operate with heavy gloves on</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>It's a pain to switch between modes, rolls easily</p><p>When a rechargeable battery runs out of juice, you don't want to sit around for hours waiting for it to recharge. You want to be able to pop in some other batteries &#8212; preferably those that are easy to find &#8212; and keep the light going.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1440274-REG/coast_20518_polysteel_600r_rechargeable_pure.html/BI/20673/KBID/15977/DFF/d10-v21-t1-x924614/SID/EZ\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Coast 600R Waterproof Flashlight</a> gives you the best of both worlds with a Li-ion rechargeable battery and a separate insert that allows you to operate the unit using 4 AA batteries. Plus, the rechargeable battery powers up using a standard micro USB charging cable that comes with the device.</p><p>The performance was also among the best in my tests. While the lumens decreased significantly after 40 minutes of operating on high, the light was still impressive after 90 minutes when drawing on either power source. The performance of the alkaline batteries appears to be better, and the light was still producing a decent beam after more than 72 hours of continuous operation.</p><p>At 8 inches long, it's one of the bigger flashlights in this guide, but it's also quite durable. On the drop test, the light didn't go out, though the stainless-steel body did make a small nick on the floor. The IPX8 waterproof rating also checked out.&#160;</p><p>The beam distance according to the manufacturer is a max of 247 meters, and it has an adjustable focus for when you want to direct your light to a specific spot. There are three brightness modes, which are a little cumbersome to switch through since you not only have to cycle through the modes, but the light also turns off between each mode.&#160;</p>\n\tThe best flashlight for long-term brightness\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2c44b158c24d3ac9595552?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Thrunite Flashlight\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong>If you want a light that starts bright and stays bright for up to two hours, the </strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07JLKWQBR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07JLKWQBR&#38;linkId=6b648e01ec1f6bc30a2f5366b24de6fc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>ThruNite TC15 Ultra-Bright Flashlight</strong></a><strong> is your best bet.</strong></h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Very bright, 5 brightness options plus strobe, IPX8 waterproof, handled a drop from 10 feet, 246-meter beam distance</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Uses a 18650 battery, gets incredibly hot after a while on max, power/mode selector button could be better</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07JLKWQBR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07JLKWQBR&#38;linkId=6b648e01ec1f6bc30a2f5366b24de6fc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">ThruNite TC15 Ultra-Bright Flashlight</a> is a durable and powerful little light. At 5 inches long by 1 inch in diameter, it's small enough to fit in your pocket while its heavy-duty anodized aluminum (<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/6061_aluminium_alloy\">T6061-T6</a>)&#160; body is IPX8 waterproof resistant and can handle being submerged in water. The flashlight also withstood a 10-foot drop without a problem.</p><p>In the brightness tests, the TC15 did an extraordinary job. It just missed out on being the brightest from the start, and it only dimmed slightly over the course of the next hour and a half. It was the brightest by far at the end of the testing period.&#160;</p><p>There are five brightness levels plus a strobe mode effect. ThruNite warns against running the flashlight on max brightness for more than ten minutes to protect the battery and I found this to be good advice, especially since the light gets too hot to hold when you keep it on Turbo for an extended period.</p><p>Though it performed well, there were a few downsides. You need a 18650 battery to operate the flashlight. Fortunately, the TC15 does come with a rechargeable ThruNite brand 3100mAh battery and a micro USB charge cord. Since the light runs so bright, the battery lasted less than two hours on top mode. You likely won't use that high for long, and the dimmer modes lasted much longer.</p><p>The last negative is the on/off/mode selector button: It's very easy to accidentally turn it on. Switching between modes isn't intuitive, either. For instance, to engage Turbo mode, you double click the button. For strobe, you double click again. If you don't use the flashlight often, you'll want to keep the user manual handy.</p>\n\tThe best penlight\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2c44d60ef1883b9a70654c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Coast HP3R\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong>The </strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00UP3TOEA/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00UP3TOEA&#38;linkId=bf9b1093172d6f33c18d5707f538566c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Coast HP3R Penlight</strong></a><strong> is compact enough to keep in your pocket on a daily basis and provides an adjustable focus light right where you need it.</strong></h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Dual power &#8211; 2 AAA batteries and rechargeable Li-ion, long battery life, adjustable beam focus, passed our drop test, doesn't roll easily</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Limited lighting modes, only IPX4 water-resistant, easy to accidentally turn on</p><p>Due to their compact size, penlights tend not to perform as well as other flashlights. However, if you need a light that directs a bright beam right where you need and is easy to pop into your shirt or pants pocket, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00UP3TOEA/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00UP3TOEA&#38;linkId=bf9b1093172d6f33c18d5707f538566c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coast HP3R Penlight</a> does an excellent job.&#160;</p><p>Based in Portland, Oregon, Coast focuses on LED lights for professionals, such as law enforcement, search and rescue teams, and oil rig workers. Jake Keller, the SAR trainer we interviewed for this article, lists Coast as one of a handful of brands he highly recommends. And, the company backs its products with <a href=\"https://coastportland.com/pages/warranty\">a lifetime warranty</a> against defects in workmanship and materials.&#160;</p><p>What I like most about the HP3R is that it operates on 2 AAA alkaline batteries or using the included Li-ion rechargeable battery, which charges using a standard micro USB charging cord. The alkaline batteries (which are included) lasted much longer than the rechargeable (72+ hours vs. 6 hours on high), but the rechargeable batteries produced a brighter beam.</p><p>Neither power source was particularly bright compared to the full-size flashlights, but thanks to the adjustable lens, you can direct the beam right where you want it &#8212; and the beam distance is up to 93 meters.</p><p>Though the light is only IPX4 water-resistant, which means it's protected from splashes of water from any direction but can't handle submersion, the anodized aluminum body handled the drop test with no effects on its performance.&#160;</p><p>The biggest negatives were that the penlight is easy to accidentally turn on, and it takes some practice to get the hang of adjusting between its two brightness options. The mode sequence as you press the power/mode selector button is high-off-low-off-high. However, if the light is off for a few seconds, the light remembers the last mode you were in. So, if you habitually use high brightness, you don't need to cycle through modes each time you turn the light on.</p>\n\tWhat else was considered\n\t\n\t<p>I looked at several flashlight brands and models while researching this guide and the following just missed the cut but are still worth considering.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07QW842D6/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07QW842D6&#38;linkId=0286645919462696a86bfaa93529ab31\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>ThruNite T1</strong></a><strong> ($39.99): </strong>There's a lot to like about the T1. It has four brightness options plus strobe, is made with durable T6061-T6 aircraft-grade anodized aluminum that stood up to the drop test, and it's IPX8 waterproof. Plus, it was the smallest light I tested at just 2.5 inches long, 1 inch in diameter, and 2.5 ounces. It also gets quite bright and maintains its brightness. It wasn't included because it relies on an uncommon 18350 rechargeable battery that has a short runtime. It was also a pain switching between light modes.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08H1P6L4T/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08H1P6L4T&#38;linkId=fee9370083f8afa31b67fc858d9fedc2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>ThruNite Archer 2A</strong></a><strong> ($29.99): </strong>The Archer 2A is similar to the T1 in a lot of ways: Similar durable body material, same waterproof rating, and the same brightness/strobe modes. The biggest differences are that the Archer 2A is more of a penlight with a body that's 6 inches long and &#190; inches in diameter. And, the 2A relies on 2 AA batteries for operation, which are easier to switch out but didn't perform as well in the brightness tests, which is a big reason why it didn't make it into the guide.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08622QMT3/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08622QMT3&#38;linkId=baacf2795abc8f8e915999847802b1e4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Coast SX300R</strong></a><strong> ($59.99): </strong>The SX300R is all about options. It operates using a rechargeable Li-ion battery or 4 AAA batteries. The body extends to access LED lights incorporated into the body with white, red, and flashing red modes. The tail cap features a strong magnet allowing you to stick the flashlight where you want it. It's not included in the guide because it isn't waterproof, the light went out in our drop test, and it's easy to accidentally turn on. However, you might overlook these negatives if you need a good area light.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01KH2JP5G/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01KH2JP5G&#38;linkId=60ba7fbe30d65460c7b6a52a9072da9a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Anker Bolder LC90</strong></a><strong> ($29.99): </strong>This was one of the top performers in the brightness test starting out bright and maintaining a strong lumen output. It has adjustable focus and three brightness settings, including a strobe and SOS function. Unfortunately, it's a bit cumbersome to switch between the light modes and is easy to accidentally turn on.&#160; Plus, it isn't waterproof, rolls easily, and relies on a relatively uncommon 18650 battery.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PH79G8B/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PH79G8B&#38;linkId=f033c1f387776502ff075489e1e3b808\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Headspin</strong></a><strong> ($135.99): </strong>If you like camping, you should consider this versatile light. The Headspin has a small base light that attaches to one of four mounts: Headlamp, magnet, bike, and flashlight. I was unimpressed with the rechargeable battery, which can't be switched out and only lasted for 90 minutes on high. To its credit, the lumen output didn't decrease much during the runtime. Also, I didn't like that it isn't waterproof, just IP66 water-resistant.</p>\n\tHow we test\n\t\n\t<p>There are several tests I put each model through to thoroughly review each option. The most important factors to consider are <strong>brightness</strong>,&#160;<strong>battery power, light modes,&#160;</strong>and&#160;<strong>durability.</strong> Here's how I considered each of those factors while testing:</p><p><strong>Brightness: </strong>I used a <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B005A0ETXY/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_101617_best-flashlights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B005A0ETXY&#38;linkId=881681949e79fb5b014cc2ca83a9ed94\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">light meter</a> and an old mattress box to measure the lumens of each flashlight. I cut two holes in one end of the 42-inch-long box (one hole for the flashlight to shine through and another for the light sensor). I then covered the interior with white paper and measured the lumens of the reflected light with the flashlight set to max brightness and a wide beam. I recorded measurements every 10 minutes for an hour and a half. This showed both the brightness of the reflected light and how that changed over time. For most models, the lumen output decreased by at least 50 percent in the first 10 minutes.</p><p><strong>Battery power: </strong>After the 90-minute brightness test, I let each battery operate on high until it was out of juice. Though a few still produced a dim light after a few hours some put off a marginally bright light for days. I also looked at whether the flashlight used common batteries (i.e., AA or AAA) that are easy to replace or if it used a popular charging cord in the case of rechargeable batteries.</p><p><strong>Light modes: </strong>How many brightness options are there? Are there other colors or functions, such as strobe or SOS? Is it easy to switch between the different modes? These are all questions I considered when examining each flashlight.</p><p><strong>Durability</strong>: You don't want your flashlight to break easily. To test durability, I dropped each flashlight from 10 feet above a flight of hardwood stairs. None of the flashlights broke but the light went out on a few of them, which would make it hard to find if dropped in the dark. I also looked at whether they were waterproof or just water-resistant. If waterproof (<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IP_Code\">IPX8</a>), I submerged the flashlight in water for at least five minutes to see if it continued to function normally.</p><p>Additionally, I examined whether the flashlights had adjustable focus, were easy to turn on by accident, and how they were to operate with gloves on.&#160;</p>\n</div><div Brains)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f2c5e412438173f5775c23e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn96@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-34-255_50be8a1cfc49ee05.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa08a9e1df1d5001821875b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn59@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-43-328_e3b512e38a570d5c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f2c44a15af6cc385a1c6862?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn64@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-46-751_41403d87b3cd1d12.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f2c44b158c24d3ac9595552?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn2@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-53-131_a24ed64bcf00874b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f2c44d60ef1883b9a70654c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn88@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-39-434_f3546c9652fe9087.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=b0fqYGNcAEM:3PvbH1Wk2lQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn23@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-41-853_d2813aae74705e16.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=b0fqYGNcAEM:3PvbH1Wk2lQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn66@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-37-142_3b324ac11a54290b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=b0fqYGNcAEM:3PvbH1Wk2lQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn60@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-42-274_0f1fceea528b39b6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/b0fqYGNcAEM":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490669},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"The head of the World Health Organization is in quarantine after a contact tested positive for COVID-19 — and he hasn't been tested yet","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/who-head-quarantining-after-contact-tested-positive-covid-19-coronavirus-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa04d3a69331a0011bc6c3e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tedros in quarantine\" height=\"1484\" width=\"2504\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Director General of the World Health Organization is in quarantine at home, after exposure to a person who tested positive for COVID-19.\n<p class=\"copyright\">World Health Organization virtual press conference November 2, 2020/Zoom screenshot</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The head of the World Health Organization is in quarantine after someone he came into contact with tested positive for COVID-19.</li>\n<li>WHO Director General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said he's not showing symptoms of the virus.</li>\n<li>His colleagues at WHO headquarters said in a virtual press conference on Monday afternoon that \"he will be tested as necessary at the appropriate time,\" but that for now \"he is at home, in quarantine, and as you can see, very well and working away.\"</li>\n<li>It makes sense that Tedros wouldn't be tested yet if he was exposed to the virus in recent days: typically, the virus incubates for at least a few days before people get sick.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The head of the World Health Organization (WHO) is quarantining at home after a person he was in contact with tested positive for COVID-19, the illness caused by the coronavirus.&#160;</p><p>WHO Director General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus first announced his <a href=\"https://twitter.com/DrTedros/status/1323032927492542465\">exposure in a Tweet on Sunday.</a> On Monday, he Zoomed into the regularly scheduled press conference that his colleagues were holding from WHO headquarters in Geneva, and repeated his status:&#160;</p><p>\"I have been identified as a contact of someone who has tested positive for COVID-19,\" he said. \"I am well and without symptoms but will self-quarantine in the coming days, in line with WHO protocols.\"</p><p><a href=\"https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/question-and-answers-hub/q-a-detail/coronavirus-disease-covid-19\">The WHO says</a> that people who have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-quarantine-covid-19-if-you-were-exposed-2020-10\">been exposed to a person who has COVID-19 should isolate</a> for two weeks. This means they should not go to work, school, or public places. Ideally, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-quarantine-covid-19-if-you-were-exposed-2020-10\">quarantiners should also stay in a separate bedroom and use a separate bathroom</a> from people who were not exposed to the virus, avoiding sharing air in case they get sick.&#160;</p><p>\"At this time, it's critically important that we all comply with health guidance. This is how we will break chains of transmission, suppress the virus, and protect health systems,\" Tedros said.&#160;</p><p>At the Monday press conference, WHO officials also seemed to signal that Tedros' exposure probably didn't happen at work.</p><p>\"We haven't had any transmission take place on the premises, we have no clusters on the premises, but it is something we are monitoring every day,\" WHO's technical lead for the coronavirus, Maria Van Kerkhove, said. \"Everything that we are recommending to the world we are putting in place here as well.\"&#160;</p><h2>Tedros hasn't been tested yet, which makes sense if he was only just exposed</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8df610c21cfb0019468e27?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mike ryan WHO tedros\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus (right) speaks with WHO Health Emergencies Programme Director Dr. Michael Ryan during a press briefing on COVID-19 at the WHO headquarters in Geneva on March 6, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Fabrice Coffrini/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Pandemic precautions in place at the WHO headquarters include more teleworking, aimed at reducing the number of staff coming in, added handwashing stations, capacity limits on meeting rooms and offices, temperature checks on arrival, symptom monitoring, and mask-wearing in open spaces.&#160;</p><p>\"This is not a zero risk situation, we've said it again and again: there is no environment right now in the world that is without risk,\" WHO's executive director of health emergencies Mike Ryan said about the recent precautions. \"We believe we have put in place appropriate and robust risk-management measures that balance the risk of the disease against our need to provide the services that we must provide to our member states and the world.\"</p><p>Ryan added that Tedros has not yet been tested for the virus, which makes sense if he was only just exposed.&#160;&#160;</p><p>\"He is at home, in quarantine, and as you can see, very well and working away, and continuing to do his job,\" Ryan said.&#160;\"His testing will depend on the arrival of symptoms or otherwise, and he may be tested in the days to come, but our current protocols don't require that he be tested.\"</p><h2>It usually takes around 5 to 7 days from the time a person is exposed to the virus for them to test positive, if they have contracted COVID-19</h2><p>Public <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/when-to-get-tested-for-covid-quarantine-2020-10\">health experts agree it generally takes around five to seven days</a> from the time a person is exposed to the virus for them to develop an infection.&#160;</p><p>\"If you've been exposed, get into quarantine,\" Virginia Tech professor and public health expert Lisa Lee <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/when-to-get-tested-for-covid-quarantine-2020-10\">recently told Insider</a>. \"This idea that we've been exposed, and we're just going to wait around to see if we're positive is a bad idea.\"</p><article tabindex=\"0\" role=\"article\" data-focusable=\"true\" aria-labelledby=\"tweet-promoted-label conversation-level-label tweet-social-context tweet-user-name tweet-user-screen-name tweet-timestamp tweet-reply-context tweet-text tweet-rich-content-label conversation-control-label tweet-action-buttons\"></article><article tabindex=\"0\" role=\"article\" data-focusable=\"true\" aria-labelledby=\"tweet-promoted-label conversation-level-label tweet-social-context tweet-user-name tweet-user-screen-name tweet-timestamp tweet-reply-context tweet-text tweet-rich-content-label conversation-control-label tweet-action-buttons\"></article><article tabindex=\"0\" role=\"article\" data-focusable=\"true\" aria-labelledby=\"tweet-promoted-label conversation-level-label tweet-social-context tweet-user-name tweet-user-screen-name tweet-timestamp tweet-reply-context tweet-text tweet-rich-content-label conversation-control-label tweet-action-buttons\">As the head of the WHO, Tedros has helped to lead the global response to the coronavirus pandemic — which has now&#160;infected more than 46 million people and killed more than 1.2 million people, <a href=\"https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/map.html\">according to data from Johns Hopkins University</a>.</article><p>But the virus is now reaching new peaks across Europe and the US, including in Switzerland, home of the WHO offices.</p><p>Tedros <a href=\"https://www.ndtv.com/world-news/we-cannot-give-up-who-chief-says-of-pandemic-fight-2316111\">said in a briefing in October</a> that \"We must not give up\" and acknowledged that what he called \"pandemic fatigue\" had set in globally, making people less likely to follow guidance and restrictions.</p><article tabindex=\"0\" role=\"article\" data-focusable=\"true\" aria-labelledby=\"tweet-promoted-label conversation-level-label tweet-social-context tweet-user-name tweet-user-screen-name tweet-timestamp tweet-reply-context tweet-text tweet-rich-content-label conversation-control-label tweet-action-buttons\">\"It's tough and the fatigue is real,\" he said.</article><article tabindex=\"0\" role=\"article\" 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"Military veterans are deploying their own 'quick reaction force' to counter Trump's 'Army' at the polls","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/military-vets-against-trumps-army-polls-election-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa0473b69331a0011bc6c10?format=jpeg\" alt=\"veterans portland\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Military veterans attend a protest against racial inequality and police violence in Portland, Oregon, July 31, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Caitlin Ochs</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Military veterans anticipating disturbance at polling places throughout the country organized a nonviolent \"quick reaction force\" &#8212; a term used in the armed forces for the small teams that provide immediate assistance in an emergency.</li>\n<li>Roughly 200 veterans signed up with a progressive organization to train in deescalation techniques for use at polling locations. The unarmed veteran-volunteers handed out water, hand sanitizers, and face masks for voters waiting in lines.</li>\n<li>The effort comes as President Trump's reelection campaign kicked off a recruitment effort for an \"Army\" of poll watchers.</li>\n<li>\"As veterans we have put our lives on the line in defense of our country before, and we are mobilizing now,\" the executive director of Common Defense said.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Military veterans anticipating disturbance at polling places throughout the country established a nonviolent \"quick reaction force\" — a term used in the armed forces for the small teams that respond immediately in an emergency.</p><p>In the last few weeks, roughly 200 veterans signed up to train in deescalation techniques with Common Defense, a grassroots organization aimed at electing progressive candidates and advancing policies for former service members. The veterans also mobilized to 45 different cities throughout the country in order to recruit other veterans to join their cause.</p><p>\"Our purpose ... is to make sure that we have an election that is fair and that is peaceful,\" Stephanie Flores, Common Defense's communications manager and US Navy veteran, told Insider.</p><p>Flores said the organization taught various deescalation techniques for the veteran-volunteers to protest safely and to \"make sure all of our ballots are counted\" during the election season.</p><p>\"We've heard it everywhere in the media, even the FBI, there is a real threat about armed militias and all of that,\" Flores said, referring to reports of voter intimidation by armed citizens. \"So that's why we're preparing our veterans and our leaders to be ready to deescalate and protest safely. But our main goal and how we're planning to do this is through narrative.</p><p>\"As veterans, we swore an oath to protect our democracy, which also means ensuring a fair election where all the votes are counted transparently,\" Flores added.</p><p>Numerous allegations of voter intimidation surfaced after states began their early voting process — some of reports insinuating some sort of involvement by the US military. In one voting site hosted by a public library near Miami, Florida, on Saturday, a person wearing military fatigues was seen standing behind supporters of President Donald Trump, according to an <a href=\"https://twitter.com/c_sesin/status/1322583128762929152?s=20\">NBC News</a> journalist.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Carmen Sesin  (@c_sesin) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1322583128762929152?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 31, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>The man wore a previous version of the US Army's combat uniform — complete with a unit crest his beret and VELCRO patches signifying their current affiliation with the military branch — and a pistol holster on his thigh.</p><p>Despite his appearance, the man was likely not currently in the service: his facial beard was in violation of the Army's grooming standards; and based on his physical appearance, he likely did not meet the service's body-fat and weight standards.</p><p>The man's appearance alarmed some veterans, many of whom emphasized that people without military experience would not be able to tell the difference between him and an active-duty service member.</p><p>\"Whether he served in the Army at one time or not, his presence at a polling site in this uniform creates the appearance of military involvement in political activities,\" retired Marine Corps Col. David Lapan, a former Pentagon spokesman, told Insider. \"However, if he's not currently serving — active duty, National Guard or Reserve — he's not in violation of [Defense Department] regulations.\"</p><p>\"Whether it's a current uniform or an old one, the appearance to the public of inappropriate military involvement in elections is the same,\" Lapan added.</p><p>The example at the public library in Miami may have been an isolated incident, according to Alex McCoy, Common Defense's policy director and a Marine Corps veteran.</p><p>\"We expected there to be a lot more right-wing group voter intimidation at polling places and early voting sites than there actually seems to have been,\" McCoy told Insider. \"Any of it is bad, obviously, but we were worried it would be more extensive and more widespread.\"</p><p>McCoy added that the group was still preparing for \"very limited counter-demonstrations\" in the country and that his members would \"be present and be visible as a deescalatory measure.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa0898369331a0011bc6def?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tarrant County Elections Center Election Line\" height=\"2016\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>People wait in line to vote on the last day of early voting on October 29, 2020, in Fort Worth, Texas.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Montinique Monroe/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2>'We have put our lives on the line in defense of our country before'</h2><p>On Saturday, six veteran-volunteers handed out water, hand sanitizers, and face masks for voters waiting in lines at a polling place in North Carolina.</p><p>Kyle Pritz, the lead organizer for Common Defense's North Carolina branch and a former US Marine, said his team was specifically called upon for assistance by another organization that experienced \"overt\" instances of voter intimidation from \"neo-Confederates.\"</p><p>North Carolina has been fraught with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/charlottesville-one-year-anniversary-photos-protests-heather-heyer-memorial-2018-8\">racial tensions</a> amid the ongoing Black Lives Matter movement and the 2017 Charlottesville protests that turned into a deadly car attack. At a separate protest in the same county on Saturday, several people, including children, were <a href=\"https://www.newsobserver.com/news/local/article246861942.html\">pepper-sprayed</a> by law enforcement officials during a march to the polls. Police officials claimed the protest was unsafe and that the activists did not disperse after being ordered to do so.</p><p>Pritz said the polling site, which shared a parking lot with a church, was mostly uneventful; however, he noted that patrons at a bar across the street were brandishing their handguns. It is legal to openly carry a firearm in the state.</p><p>Volunteers had to sign waivers to attend the event and received guidance beyond their normal training on deescalation methods. The military veterans were instructed not to wear any clothing containing military camouflage and were prohibited from carrying weapons. Most of them wore regular clothes with \"veteran signifiers,\" such as a hat denoting their military service.</p><p>All volunteers were also vetted for their military service and were interviewed to make sure they were competent enough to control themselves if things escalated, according to Flores, the organization's communications manager.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f65341757b7da001ee12996?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump nevada rally\" height=\"1148\" width=\"2297\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brendan Smialowski/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The effort comes as President Trump's reelection campaign kicked off a recruitment effort for an \"Army\" of <a href=\"https://www.propublica.org/article/so-far-trumps-army-of-poll-watchers-looks-more-like-a-small-platoon\">poll watchers</a> — a term that is supposed to be used for certified individuals to monitor voting processes for fairness.</p><p>Each state has their own regulations, but certified poll watchers are not allowed to engage with voters, and their duties — ensuring votes are counted and reporting violations — are often <a href=\"https://www.propublica.org/article/so-far-trumps-army-of-poll-watchers-looks-more-like-a-small-platoon\">mundane</a> and non-partisan.</p><p>Meanwhile, Trump's surrogates have preemptively questioned the integrity of the current election — often times fueling baseless theories like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-trump-tweet-mail-voting-warning-label-minsinformation-block-retweet-2020-10\">mail-in election fraud</a> — and appear to be conflating a self-appointed poll-watching protester with a certified poll-watcher.</p><p>Common Defense's volunteer-drive comes as military veterans have been recently spotlighted during the civil rights protests this year. Dozens of purported military veterans marched alongside other protesters in the wake of several deaths of Black people, such as in Portland, Oregon. Some of them faced their active-duty counterparts and law enforcement officials on the front lines, including US Navy veteran Christopher David, who was dramatically pepper-sprayed and beaten during the <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/20/us/portland-protester-navy-veteran-beaten/index.html\">Portland protests</a> in July.</p><p>Jose Vasquez, the executive director of Common Defense and a US Army veteran, alleged that Trump's inability to condemn racist behavior and right-wing extremism prompted him and other like-minded veterans to act.</p><p>\"We are in a historic moment of crisis that could upend our democracy unless we act to block the corruption of Donald Trump and the violence of his most extreme supporters,\" Vasquez said in a statement. \"As veterans we have put our lives on the line in defense of our country before, and we are mobilizing now in historic numbers to protect our fellow citizens and our system of democratic governance.\"</p><p>\"As veterans who swore to uphold and defend the Constitution, seeing the President refuse to commit to respect the election results and calling on fascist gangs to rally by his side is the realization of all of our worst fears,\" he added.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/military-vets-against-trumps-army-polls-election-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ktFMFfKrgdk:alT_StvM63M:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"The best humidifiers","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-humidifier","description":"<bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>An excellent humidifier can make your home's air much more comfortable to breathe, particularly when the air becomes too dry.</strong><strong>&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>There are a number of great humidifiers available, but our top pick is the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B013IJPTFK/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_062717_best-humidifiers-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B013IJPTFK&linkId=459ca5fc460428936e9e851138e08c47460428936e9e851138e08c47\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Pure Enrichment Ultrasonic Cool Mist Humidifier</a>. It's stylish, inexpensive, and versatile enough to suit most people's needs.</strong></li></ul><p>When the air gets too dry, it can potentially lead to health issues such as bloody noses, cracked lips, itchy skin, and more.</p><p>It can also simply just be uncomfortable to breathe in dry air. This is common during cold weather when a home is heated. Additionally, besides making our bodies feel discomfort, low humidity may also damage porous things like wooden furniture and framed art.</p><p>An air humidifier can help. A humidifier is an electrical appliance that uses water to add moisture to the air. Humidifiers come in different shapes and sizes, but for this guide, we focused on portable units that are affordable and can be easily purchased. Still, there are various types of portable humidifiers including those that use warm mist and cool mist. For a quick explainer on the difference, scroll to the bottom of this guide.</p><p>We looked at a variety of humidifiers to find the best ones, at a variety of price points.</p><h2>Here are the best humidifiers:</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Best overall: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B013IJPTFK/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_062717_best-humidifiers-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B013IJPTFK&linkId=459ca5fc460428936e9e851138e08c47460428936e9e851138e08c47\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Pure Enrichment Ultrasonic Cool Mist Humidifier</a></li><li>Best warm-mist humidifier: <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lowes.com%2Fpd%2FVicks-1-Gallon-Tabletop-Warm-Mist-Humidifier-For-Rooms-151-400-Square-Feet%2F100049455500494555\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Vicks Warm Mist Humidifier</a></li><li>Best for large rooms: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B006MKDRCU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_062717_best-humidifiers-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B006MKDRCU&linkId=1d68b50465fed1242b1c00815177ab2f65fed1242b1c00815177ab2f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Sunpentown SPT SU-4010 Humidifier</a></li></ul><p><em>Prices and links are current as of 11/2/20. We also updated formatting and removed our best germ-free humidier, the Honeywell HCM350W, due to it currently being out of stock.</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5952857ed084cc0c2c8b580e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"81eUh4m xVL._SL1500_\" height=\"1125\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B013IJPTFK/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_062717_best-humidifiers-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B013IJPTFK&#38;linkId=459ca5fc460428936e9e851138e08c47\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Pure Enrichment Ultrasonic Cool Mist Humidifier</a> is stylish, has two levels of misting, and even lights up for ambiance.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Stylish design, relatively cheap, dual-mist control, automatic shut off, night light</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Not great for larger rooms</p><p>The best humidifier is the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B013IJPTFK/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_062717_best-humidifiers-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B013IJPTFK&#38;linkId=459ca5fc460428936e9e851138e08c47\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Pure Enrichment Ultrasonic Cool Mist Humidifier</a>. Not only is this an excellent and reliable portable humidifier, but it's also affordable.</p><p>This cool-mist model has a number of great features. It can humidify the air for up to 16 hours of continuous use leaving no need to worry about replacing the water often, thanks to the 1.5-liter water tank.</p><p>The device also has choices of either single or dual-mist nozzles, so you may switch the humidifier to output different levels of mist. An automatic shut-off feature detects when the water level is getting low or if the water tank has been removed. And, it can function as a night light (blue, green, or red).</p><p>Because it's small and compact, it isn't effective for larger rooms. The company offers an \"XL\" version with a larger water tank and longer continuous run-time, or you can <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B006MKDRCU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_062717_best-humidifiers-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B006MKDRCU&#38;linkId=1d68b50465fed1242b1c00815177ab2f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">check out our pick for large rooms</a>.</p>\n\tThe best warm-mist\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/595289cea3630ff9008b5c16?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Vicks humidifier\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Vicks/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Vicks' <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lowes.com%2Fpd%2FVicks-1-Gallon-Tabletop-Warm-Mist-Humidifier-For-Rooms-151-400-Square-Feet%2F1000494555\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Warm Mist Humidifier</a> has a gallon-sized water tank, an automatic shut-off feature, and is ideal for anyone who is sick.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Warm mist is great for sinus issues, large water tank, two settings, relatively inexpensive</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Device gets hot, not suitable for homes with children or pets</p><p>While most people prefer cool-mist humidifiers, in some situations, warm-mist humidifiers are simply better, such as when you're sick and trying to clear a stuffed-up nose. In that case, there's one humidifier that stands above the rest: the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lowes.com%2Fpd%2FVicks-1-Gallon-Tabletop-Warm-Mist-Humidifier-For-Rooms-151-400-Square-Feet%2F1000494555\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Vicks Warm Mist Humidifier</a>.</p><p>The device has a big water tank (1 gallon), which allows it to operate for up to 12 hours on a single filling. It runs quietly and there is a night light, which is helpful if you're running it overnight.</p><p>The high setting works great for larger rooms, while the lower setting will be a little calmer for small spaces. The way that it works is, the tank feeds the water into a boiling chamber where it's then heated. The vapor produced is up to 95-percent bacteria-free, according to Vicks. The humidifier has an automatic shut-off, so it will turn off when the water runs out.</p>\n\tThe best for large rooms\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/59528942d084cca0008b5cdc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Sunpentown humidifier\" height=\"1050\" width=\"1400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sunpentown/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B006MKDRCU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_062717_best-humidifiers-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B006MKDRCU&#38;linkId=1d68b50465fed1242b1c00815177ab2f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Sunpentown SPT SU-4010 Humidifier</a> doesn't just have a large tank, it also offers both warm and cool mist settings, and the ability to control the mist output.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Warm and cool mist settings, higher mist output for larger rooms, ability to adjust mist output</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> A little noisy, on the pricey side&#160;</p><p>If you're looking for a humidifier for an expansive room, you'll probably want something with a larger water tank that's capable of outputting more mist. The best is the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B006MKDRCU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_062717_best-humidifiers-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B006MKDRCU&#38;linkId=1d68b50465fed1242b1c00815177ab2f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Sunpentown SPT SU-4010 Humidifier</a>.</p><p>The humidifier has a gallon-sized water tank, but it's powerful enough to humidify rooms as large as 500 square feet.</p><p>Unlike our other recommendations, this device offers the option of cool-mist or warm-mist settings, which makes it incredibly versatile. It can run for up to 10 hours on the warm-mist setting or 12 hours if you opt for cool. You can also adjust the mist output.</p>\n\tWhich is better: warm mist or cool mist?\n\t\n\t<p>In general, humidifiers are divided into \"warm mist\" and \"cool mist.\"</p><p>Warm-mist humidifiers release moisture into the air by heating it, which kills bacteria in the water. But, if there are children or animals in the house, warm-mist humidifiers can be hazardous because of how hot the appliance becomes, as well as the potential for accidentally spilled hot water.</p><p>Within the cool-mist humidifier segment, there are three types:</p><ul><li><strong>Ultrasonic humidifiers</strong>&#160;use high-frequency waves to split water drops into particles, which are then released into the room.</li><li><strong>Evaporative humidifiers </strong>take the room's air and pass it through a filter with water in it, creating a mist. That mist is then blown out the other end of the humidifier.</li><li><strong>Impeller humidifiers</strong> are similar to ultrasonic humidifiers, but instead of using ultrasonic waves, they break-up water drops using a rotating disc. These humidifiers operate louder than the others.</li></ul><p>The option you should choose depends on your environment. The Mayo Clinic <a href=\"https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/common-cold/expert-answers/cool-mist-humidifiers/faq-20058199\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">recommends cool-mist humidifiers</a> if you have children, because of the aforementioned safety concerns. It also said that both cool-mist and warm-mist humidifiers are equally effective. However, cool-mist humidifiers require more cleaning because they have a higher chance of bacteria and mold growth. It's also recommended that distilled or purified water be used instead of tap water.</p><p>As mentioned, warm-mist humidifiers disperse steam by heating water, rather than using a fan. They're quieter and can heat up small rooms, however, they also require more energy to operate. There are pros and cons to both, and the best option will depend on your needs.</p>\n\tCheck out our other home heating and cooling guides\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ee7dbdcf34d052ea65c2bc5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"noria air conditioner\" height=\"801\" width=\"1068\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Noria/YouTube</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-space-heater\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best space heaters</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-throw-blanket\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best throw blankets</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-tower-fan\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best tower fans</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-dehumidifier\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best dehumidifiers</a></li><li><a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/best-portable-air-conditioner\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best portable air conditioners</a></li></ul>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/best-humidifier'>Business Insider</a></div><div src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=IWHOlsHNYv0:44kDmrmF-mU:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/IWHOlsHNYv0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 02 Nov 2020 20:37:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5ee0f79c191824611b0963e4?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"2b879b1a60128ac2970a39419b05e4c4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn71@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-35-532_1f7d3fb1f6431e3a.webp","destWidth":800,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":14288,"destBytes":14288,"author":"insider@insider.com (Christian de Looper)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5952857ed084cc0c2c8b580e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn5@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-58-869_331c0a0ff48f97e0.webp","https://i.insider.com/595289cea3630ff9008b5c16?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn3@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-44-856_e54246d6a6c4dae3.webp","https://i.insider.com/59528942d084cca0008b5cdc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn89@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-52-909_47b62df45070cac2.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee7dbdcf34d052ea65c2bc5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn16@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-56-744_e31b7438e8beb740.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=IWHOlsHNYv0:44kDmrmF-mU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn80@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-34-492_3e4d75fa0f565b1a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=IWHOlsHNYv0:44kDmrmF-mU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn96@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-48-050_8e661a1f8657ca4d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=IWHOlsHNYv0:44kDmrmF-mU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn14@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-35-832_d3f4ced9d8192054.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/IWHOlsHNYv0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn61@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-36-312_836b13bef1274949.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490592},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"A federal judge threw out a Republican effort to invalidate 127,000 ballots cast at drive-thru voting locations in Texas","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/texas-drive-thru-ballots-case-ruling-federal-judge-throws-out-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9ed0f169331a0011bc6984?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Texas-drive-thru-voting\" height=\"4000\" width=\"5333\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/LM Otero</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A federal judge in Texas ruled on Monday that 127,000 ballots cast at drive-thru locations in Texas are valid.</li>\n<li>The day before the election, he rejected a lawsuit brought by Texas GOP candidates who sought to invalidate the votes by arguing that the locations, established by county election officials, weren't legitimate.</li>\n<li>It's a victory for voters and another loss for Republicans in a slew of voting lawsuits ahead of Election Day on Tuesday.</li>\n<li>The Republicans who brought the lawsuit have appealed the decision.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A federal judge dismissed a case on Monday seeking to invalidate 127,000 ballots cast at drive-thru voting locations in Texas.</p><p>The decision is a victory for voters in Harris County, which includes Houston and is the most populous county in the state.</p><p>With his decision, Judge Andrew Hanen, an appointee of former President George W. Bush, apparently reached the same conclusion as the all-Republican Texas Supreme Court, which <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/texas-ballots-harris-county-drive-thru-voting-election-2020-11\">rejected an appeal by Republicans</a> to hear a case over the same issue.</p><p>Several Republican candidates running for office in Texas, as well as Steven Hotze, a right-wing radio host <a href=\"https://www.mediamatters.org/voter-fraud-and-suppression/one-plaintiffs-who-trying-throw-out-drive-thru-votes-harris-county\">known for playing down the coronavirus pandemic</a>, brought the lawsuit against Harris County Clerk Chris Hollins.</p><p>Hollins established 10 drive-thru voting locations to make it easier for people to vote if they were anxious to enter buildings because of the coronavirus pandemic. 10% of all early votes in the county took place at those locations, <a href=\"https://www.texastribune.org/2020/11/02/texas-drive-thru-votes-harris-county/\">according to the Texas Tribune</a>.</p><p>Hotze and the candidates — Wendell Champion, Steve Toth, and Sharon Hemphill — argued such locations could be established only with the explicit approval of the Texas Legislature and sought to have the 127,000 ballots already cast to be invalidated.</p><h2>The judge said the group didn't have the standing to sue but ordered for the votes to be set aside anyway</h2><p>In court on Monday, Hanen ruled the groups did not have the standing to sue and that the ballots were legally cast.</p><p>He also admonished the plaintiffs for bringing the case only now, even though early voting had been in progress for two weeks, and Harris County already had drive-thru voting locations during primary elections over the summer.</p><p>\"I find that when you balance the harms, you've got to weigh in favor of counting the votes,\" Hanen said.</p><p>Hanen said that if the case did have standing, he would have ruled to count the 127,000 votes that had already been cast, but ban the drive-thru locations going forward, <a href=\"https://www.texastribune.org/2020/11/02/texas-drive-thru-votes-harris-county/\">according to the Texas Tribune</a>.</p><p>\"If I were voting tomorrow … I would not vote in a drive-thru just out of my concern as to whether that's illegal or not,\" he said.</p><p>Hollins said the county's drive-thru voting locations would remain open through Election Day.</p><p>\"My office and those 11,000 election workers are going to continue to be committed to protecting the right to vote for the 2.5 million voters registered here in Harris County,\" Hollins said in a statement to reporters following the ruling.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa072dc91178a0019b3dc7e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"texas houston drive-thru voting\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Voters in cars line up at a drive-thru mail-ballot drop-off site at NRG Stadium on October 7 in Houston.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Go Nakamura/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>In the lawsuit, Hollins garnered high-profile support: Democratic candidates, the Texas State Conference of NAACP Branches, the Texas Coalition of Black Democrats, and the League of Women Voters of Texas all fought for the ballots to be counted. Hollis also garnered support from the right, including the top <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2020/11/01/ben-ginsberg-voter-suppression-republicans/\">GOP election lawyer Benjamin Ginsberg</a> and the anti-Trump Republican group the Lincoln Project.</p><p>Hanen, in his decision, ordered county officials to maintain a registry of the votes that were cast at drive-thru polling places in case the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals came to a different conclusion.</p><p>Lawyers for the Republican candidates who brought the lawsuit appealed the case to the 5th Circuit later Monday. They also plan to appeal their loss in the Texas Supreme Court to the US Supreme Court, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/JanNWolfe/status/1323366874244153350\">according to the Reuters reporters Jan Wolfe and Jennifer Hiller</a>.</p><p>Texas has experienced extraordinary early turnout this election, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/texas-early-voting-record-turnout-presidential-election-biden-trump-2020-10\">surpassing 2016's total last week</a> with <a href=\"https://www.texastribune.org/2020/10/31/early-vote-tally/\">nearly 10 million votes</a>. Though no Democrat has won the presidential race in Texas for decades, it's close this year: FiveThirtyEight <a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-election-forecast/texas/\">projected a vote share</a> of 50.2% votes for President Donald Trump and 48.9% for Democratic nominee Joe Biden.</p><p>Republicans have launched dozens of lawsuits across the country seeking to limit voting. Several of them have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/supreme-court-issues-flurry-of-last-minute-election-orders-2020-10\">resulted in Supreme Court decisions</a>, and more litigation is expected.</p><p>\"Today is a victory for Texas voters and the more than 120,000 Texans who followed the rules, made a plan to drive-in vote, and exercised their constitutional right. Make no mistake: this is not a partisan victory,\" the Biden campaign said in a statement.</p><p><em>This article has been updated.</em></p><bi-shortcode id=\"expanded-coverage\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-source=\"insider-voter-guide\" data-show-header=\"true\">Expanded Coverage Module: insider-voter-guide</bi-shortcode><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original They can toss one set in their bag, leave one at work, and keep one in the car.</p>\n\tA cult-favorite clay mask that basically vacuums out pores\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5db9edcfdee01950c14d9a56?format=jpeg\" alt=\"gfmjjfgj\" height=\"1113\" width=\"1484\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Faztec-secret-indian-healing-clay-facial-treatment-15-5oz%2F-%2FA-53426756\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Aztec Secret Indian Healing Clay Mask, available at Target, $7.99</a></h3><p>The Aztec Clay Mask has been called \"the world's most powerful facial\" and it's also under $10.
