er.com/5db9e447dee0194668515c63?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn13@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-46-227_62bdbecb1cbdc05d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e1e2be5b2e66a35726d5514?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn92@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-40-261_0b8c0790d4ee91d7.webp","https://i.insider.com/5db9e953dee0194be061e382?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5db9f5aadee019526b7f9ff4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn36@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-44-168_1e4e75c84e228d50.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dbaf36ddee019560b095f64?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn100@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-40-599_d57ee5a93e45225b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5db9f9c6dee01957d3402846?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn7@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-57-782_7e143cc53a5952a1.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dbaeb0fdee01947f6692426?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn27@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-38-824_be5add72e771cb8a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5b16ec921ae6621d008b51d0?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn70@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-58-903_7b3e960bb130ac20.webp","https://i.insider.com/5db9fb0cdee01959967cdfaa?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn28@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-43-879_55e1983d16aa493b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5db9fe2fdee019657b53b198?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn41@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-51-117_46fd5b2f32b556a1.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d602e8246552c75062a9c2a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn27@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-45-122_b910a4626dc58f25.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HwP9RLHWDQ8:M0KpqapF-sw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn69@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-58-331_8883cede8b7127a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HwP9RLHWDQ8:M0KpqapF-sw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn80@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-43-424_3ac6c3f27c525b1f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HwP9RLHWDQ8:M0KpqapF-sw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn20@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-40-768_967a5b0d4e12b0b9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/HwP9RLHWDQ8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn60@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-54-661_6dd46c6f66da0d29.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490740},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"Some voters with disabilities say they feel like 'second class citizens' in their struggle to cast a ballot like the able bodied","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/voters-with-disabilities-struggling-to-cast-a-ballot-this-year-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3801e5e89ebf001f04500d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"vote covid\" height=\"4000\" width=\"5333\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Staff of the Franklin County Board of Elections take measures to sanitize voting stations and provisional ballot envelop stations in Ohio on April 28, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Matthew Hatcher/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>This year, voters with disabilities nationwide told Business Insider how they have been pushing election officials to ensure that they can cast a ballot privately and independently.</li>\n<li>Voters with disabilities face a wide array of obstacles when casting their ballots, including a lack of support from local election officials and accessibility issues at election sites.&#160;</li>\n<li>Some voters have gone to great lengths to spread awareness of these accessibility issues and create the same opportunity for themselves in Tuesday's election.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>People with disabilities in states across the country have been preparing for weeks to vote in this year's presidential election.</p><p>They've taken steps able-bodied voters ordinarily wouldn't, several people with disabilities told Business Insider. In Florida and Pennsylvania, for example, some voters told Business Insider they took on the added mantle of serving as their own advocates, attending town halls, and imploring their local election officials for guarantees that they can cast a ballot privately and independently.</p><p>Despite their preparation and research ahead of Election Day, these efforts seemed largely ineffective as accessibility issues prevailed and made it difficult to vote securely as any able-bodied person could.</p><p>Voting in person took Marsha Bukala hours. A 62-year-old visually impaired woman in Florida, Bukala detailed to Business Insider the long-winded process she had been involved in to vote securely.</p><p>Bukala chose to vote in person rather than send a ballot by mail because it had \"really, really small print\" that she wouldn't have been able to make out on her own without assistance from another person.</p><p>When she went to the polls in October, she waited in line to use the site's single available accessible voting machine. She asked the poll workers to black out the screen so she could use it without people around seeing her votes.</p><p>\"We don't know how to do that,\" Bukala said a poll worker told her. She asked the poll workers to instead turn the tables and the machine to face away from people.</p><p>The poll workers' lack of knowledge struck Bukala, who days ahead of voting had asked her county's supervisor of elections whether they would be aware of the process for in-person accessible voting.</p><p>Millions of people are opting to vote by mail this year because of the pandemic. But accessibility needs must still be met for in-person voting, according to disability rights attorney Eve Hill.</p><p>\"Many polling places discourage people with and without disabilities from using the accessible machines because of confusion about how they work,\" Hill said. \"As a result, to this day, those machines are often only used by people with disabilities, making their votes less private than the votes of people without disabilities.\"</p><p>Bukala was ultimately able to cast her vote, but the process ate away two hours of her day and underscored the issues of accessibility that continue to permeate the US election system.</p><p>People with disabilities have to put in \"a lot of work to vote in general,\" said Sarah Meek, senior director of legislative affairs at ANCOR, a national network of providers offering support services for people with disabilities.</p><p>In Pennsylvania, another voter with a disability described to Business Insider the weeks-long process she engaged in to vote, despite her taking several steps to prepare ahead of the election.</p><p>Christine Hunsinger kept checking the state's <a href=\"https://www.votespa.com/Pages/default.aspx\">website</a> with information on voting for instructions on casting her accessible ballot. For weeks, she couldn't find any updated information. She decided to attend an in-person town hall with a state legislator to ask, where she was given a link with ballot instructions she could not find on her own.</p><p>Hunsinger, who's print-impaired, also had difficulty finding the spot where she had to sign her ballot. She tried calling the county but was met with long wait times to reach someone who could help. She ultimately used an app to connect with a volunteer assistant who helped her navigate the ballot.</p><p>Measures like these take away a person's agency and make voters with disabilities feel like they're treated like a \"second-class citizen,\" said Nancy Burgess-Hall, a Florida voter. Burgess-Hall and her husband, Doug, were involved in a weeks-long lawsuit against the state of Florida to increase accessibility in voting. They reached a settlement, with all 67 Florida counties mandated to provide accessible vote-by-mail options by March 2022.</p><p>It's a step in the right direction, Doug said, to providing voters with disabilities greater agency and independence when casting a ballot.</p><p>\"Some people may choose to want to have someone to help them. I don't really want to,\" Bukala said, echoing the need for expanding options for voters with disabilities. \"I want to be able to do it on my own. And I mean, we should have that and it should work. It should be available to us and not a problem.\"</p><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li>Read more:</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-and-biden-have-inaccessible-campaign-websites-report-2020-10\">Trump and Biden's campaign websites are not entirely accessible for voters with disabilities, potentially shutting out 61 million people</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/election-sites-battleground-states-not-accessible-report-2020-9\">Millions of disabled voters could be sidelined in 12 battleground states because of their election websites, new report shows</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ballot-applications-voters-with-disabilities-43-states-inaccessible-2020-9\">Vote-by-mail applications in 43 states are not accessible to people with disabilities, possibly disenfranchising millions of voters</a></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/voters-with-disabilities-struggling-to-cast-a-ballot-this-year-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f3801e5e89ebf001f04500d?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"aab1220e438c2f28fa1bae972a48abb7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn10@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-31-411_ceeb3ab47f3fbc0b.webp","destWidth":5333,"destHeight":4000,"sourceBytes":650952,"destBytes":650952,"author":"ydzhanova@businessinsider.com (Yelena Dzhanova)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f3801e5e89ebf001f04500d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn10@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-31-411_ceeb3ab47f3fbc0b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=SyCefpXdrNo:krJFgjyzaEY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn88@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-53-478_cf0863dfca8b5249.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=SyCefpXdrNo:krJFgjyzaEY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn90@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-59-091_043a808c54e44566.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=SyCefpXdrNo:krJFgjyzaEY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn80@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-48-016_16c089f2b744d5e8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/SyCefpXdrNo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn50@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-51-276_ad0bd5aca4ba5e7f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490577},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"8 counties to watch in the presidential race between Biden and Trump","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/battleground-counties-swing-states-presidential-election-biden-trump-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9074d5212113001873ff39?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump and Biden\" height=\"2807\" width=\"4020\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Patrick Semansky/AP Photo</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President Donald Trump and Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden have strategically chosen places to campaign where they can get any available advantages.</li>\n<li>There are eight counties across the country, from Arizona and Ohio to Wisconsin and Florida, that will play outsized roles in picking the next president.</li>\n<li>The results from each county will also provide a sense of the demographic and cultural changes that exist in America today.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>With Election Day within sight, keeping tabs on a handful of counties can help cut through the noise on election night.</p><p>TV coverage of the returns usually feature myriad maps, with most swing states having one or two counties serving as a bellwether for the rest of the state.</p><p>The reason these counties say so much about their respective states comes down to a mix of population and demographics.</p><p>Maricopa County in Arizona, for example, accounted for more than half of all the votes cast in Arizona back in 2016. More often than not, that means that whoever wins Maricopa County wins Arizona.</p><p>Here's a breakdown of the eight counties that will be the most influential in the race between President Donald Trump and Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden.</p><p>&#160;</p><h3>Cuyahoga County, Ohio</h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f77ff12282c500018c786f3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cleveland-skyline\" height=\"2796\" width=\"4200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The skyline of Cleveland, Ohio.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Angelo Merendino/Corbis via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Population (2019 estimate):</strong> 1,235,072</p><p><strong>2008 results:</strong> Barack Obama 69%, John McCain 30%</p><p><strong>2012 results:</strong> Barack Obama 69%, Mitt Romney 29.5%</p><p><strong>2016 results:</strong> Hillary Clinton 66%, Donald Trump 30.5%</p><p>As Ohio has shifted to the right over the past few years, a robust Democratic turnout in Cuyahoga County, which encompasses Cleveland and an array of blue-leaning suburbs, will be critical for Joe Biden. The key for a Democratic win in the Buckeye State is to maximize turnout in Cuyahoga, especially among Black voters. In 2016, Donald Trump won Ohio by 8% — if the president can make any gains with minority groups in Cuyahoga, it could make all the difference in what is expected to be a close race in the state.</p><p>&#160;</p><h3>Maricopa County, Arizona</h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa07e8b1df1d5001821870d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Phoenix-light-rail\" height=\"2829\" width=\"4244\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A view of Downtown Phoenix.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Christian Petersen/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Population (2019 estimate):</strong> 4,485,414</p><ul><li>2008: Barack Obama 44%, John McCain 54%</li><li>2012: Barack Obama 44%, Mitt Romney 54%</li><li>2016: Hillary Clinton 45%, Donald Trump 48%</li></ul><p>Maricopa County, which includes Phoenix, is one of the fastest-growing counties in the nation and accounts for roughly 61 percent of the state's population. The county has consistently voted for Republican presidential nominees since 1952, but Democrats have made major gains here over the past decade. Democrat Kyrsten Sinema, who was elected to the Senate in 2018, carried Maricopa by 60,000 votes in her successful campaign. Whoever wins Maricopa County will most likely win the state.</p><p>&#160;</p><h3>Seminole County, Florida</h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa087cb69331a0011bc6ddf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sanford-seminole\" height=\"2650\" width=\"3977\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Seminole County Courthouse in Sanford.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/John Raoux</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Population (2019 estimate): </strong>1,235,072</p><p><strong>Past presidential election results:&#160;</strong></p><ul><li><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">2008 results:</strong> Barack Obama 48%, John McCain 51%</li><li><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">2012 results:</strong> Barack Obama 46%, Mitt Romney 53%</li><li><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">2016 results:</strong> Hillary Clinton 47%, Donald Trump 48%</li></ul><p>Seminole County, once a sleepy outpost of Orlando, has become a fast-growing bedroom community in Central Florida. For generations, the county has supported Republicans — the last Democratic presidential nominee to win here was Harry Truman in 1948. However, Donald Trump only won the county by 1% in 2016, and Democrats have made enormous gains in suburban areas over the past four years. US Congresswoman Stephanie Murphy, a moderate Democrat and the first Vietnamese-American woman ever elected to Congress, is representative of the growing diversity of the area. In a state that consistently has razor-thin election results, any advantage in Seminole will be crucial for Biden and Trump.</p><p>&#160;</p><h3><strong>Wake County, North Carolina</strong></h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa058e96f5b310011724e34?format=jpeg\" alt=\"raleigh north carolina wake county skyline\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The skyline of Raleigh, North Carolina.\n<p class=\"copyright\">The Washington Post via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Population (2019 estimate):&#160;</strong>1,111,761</p><p><strong>Past presidential election results:&#160;</strong></p><ul><li><strong>2008:&#160;</strong>Barack Obama 53%, John McCain 43%</li><li><strong>2012: </strong>Barack Obama 54%, Mitt Romney 44%</li><li><strong>2016:&#160;</strong>Hillary Clinton 57%, Donald Trump 37%</li></ul><p>Wake County is the most populous in North Carolina and includes the state capital, Raleigh. It broke about the same way for Barack Obama when he won the state in 2008 compared to when he lost it in 2012, but its sharp dip in support for Donald Trump in 2016 fits a broader pattern of these centers of highly educated voters and transplants moving toward the Democratic Party in greater numbers.</p><p>&#160;</p><h3>Milwaukee County, Wisconsin</h3><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa05ac26f5b310011724e44?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Milwaukee Wisconsin\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Milwaukee was supposed to be the site of the Democratic National Convention this year, but the coronavirus pandemic led the party to go for a mostly remote version instead.\n<p class=\"copyright\">MattGush/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p><strong>Population (2019 estimate):&#160;</strong>947,735</p><p><strong>Past presidential election results:&#160;</strong></p><ul><li><strong>2008:&#160;</strong>Barack Obama 68%, John McCain 31%</li><li><strong>2012: </strong>Barack Obama 66%, Mitt Romney 32%</li><li><strong>2016:&#160;</strong>Hillary Clinton 65%, Donald Trump 28%</li></ul><p>Turnout has been a major focus for Democrats in Milwaukee County, with a dip of nearly 20% among Black voters in 2016 cited as a fatal flaw for Hillary Clinton's campaign when she lost the Badger State to Donald Trump. Of Milwaukee's 15 city council wards, the five poorest and most heavily African-American saw the <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/21/us/many-in-milwaukee-neighborhood-didnt-vote-and-dont-regret-it.html\">biggest declines in voter participation</a> that year.</p><p>Both the Biden and Trump campaigns will be watching the margins and the overall turnout numbers in Milwaukee County to get a better idea of who's poised to win Wisconsin.</p><h3>Erie County, Pennsylvania</h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa05e7669331a0011bc6ccc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"erie\" height=\"1060\" width=\"2121\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Erie County is one of just 206 counties nationwide that voted for Donald Trump in 2016 after going for Barack Obama both in 2012 and 2008.\n<p class=\"copyright\">DenisTangneyJr/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Population (2019 estimate):&#160;</strong>269,728</p><p><strong>Past presidential election results:&#160;</strong></p><ul><li><strong>2008:&#160;</strong>Barack Obama 59%, John McCain 39%</li><li><strong>2012: </strong>Barack Obama 57%, Mitt Romney 41%</li><li><strong>2016:&#160;</strong>Hillary Clinton 47%, Donald Trump 48%</li></ul><p>Erie County was one of 206 counties nationwide that voted for Donald Trump in 2016 after going for Barack Obama both in 2012 and 2008.</p><p>Even though it's only the 15th biggest county in Pennsylvania, Erie's concentration of white working class voters and its status as a former Democratic Party stronghold make it an ideal case study in measuring Trump's support.</p><p>&#160;</p><h3>Gwinnett County, Georgia</h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa065c46f5b310011724e81?format=jpeg\" alt=\"gwinnett county georgia\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The exterior of Gwinnett County Courthouse.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jeffrey Greenberg/Universal Images Group via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Population (2019 estimate): </strong>936,250</p><p><strong>Past presidential election results:&#160;</strong></p><ul><li><strong>2008:&#160;</strong>Barack Obama 44%, John McCain 54%</li><li><strong>2012: </strong>Barack Obama 44%, Mitt Romney 53%</li><li><strong>2016:&#160;</strong>Hillary Clinton 51%, Donald Trump 45%</li></ul><p>Gwinnett County is the second-most populous county in Georgia behind Fulton County, home to Atlanta. It has evolved from a GOP stronghold to voting for Hillary Clinton in 2016, another mark of suburban voters moving toward the Democrats.</p><p>&#160;</p><h3>Macomb County, Michigan</h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa084711df1d50018218732?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Warren-MI\" height=\"2670\" width=\"4005\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fitzgerald Recreation Center in Warren, Michigan.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Elaine Cromie/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>Population (2019 estimate): </strong>873,972</p><p><strong>Past presidential election results:&#160;</strong></p><ul><li><strong>2008:&#160;</strong>Barack Obama 53%, John McCain 45%</li><li><strong>2012: </strong>Barack Obama 51%, Mitt Romney 47%</li><li><strong>2016:&#160;</strong>Hillary Clinton 42%, Donald Trump 54%</li></ul><p>For decades, Macomb County has been known as the home of Reagan Democrats, the blue-collar, culturally conservative Democrats who shifted to the GOP in presidential elections. The county, immediately north of Detroit, is still a middle-class stronghold and remains politically competitive. Barack Obama won Macomb handily in 2008 and 2012, but Donald Trump easily took the county in 2016 and it made all the difference in winning Michigan. That year, the president won Macomb by 48,348 votes, but only won the state by 10,704 votes.</p><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/battleground-counties-swing-states-presidential-election-biden-trump-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=URZMKNnlJBw:1wAh_DK10xc:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=URZMKNnlJBw:1wAh_DK10xc:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=URZMKNnlJBw:1wAh_DK10xc:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=URZMKNnlJBw:1wAh_DK10xc:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=URZMKNnlJBw:1wAh_DK10xc:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=URZMKNnlJBw:1wAh_DK10xc:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=URZMKNnlJBw:1wAh_DK10xc:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=URZMKNnlJBw:1wAh_DK10xc:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/URZMKNnlJBw\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 02 Nov 2020 23:18:27 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f9074e4abcd0c0018d68da1?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"d45743ccc96cdf821b2507f630101bc0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn68@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-50-296_5dbcfaab837fc62c.webp","destWidth":3742,"destHeight":2806,"sourceBytes":264964,"destBytes":264964,"author":"insider@insider.com (John L. Dorman,Jake Lahut)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9074d5212113001873ff39?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn14@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-55-143_8d8b1a0564ac3c55.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f77ff12282c500018c786f3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn30@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-57-976_59dc0936dc2a8f22.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa07e8b1df1d5001821870d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn27@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-49-148_1e743b90ce141dd9.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa087cb69331a0011bc6ddf?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn29@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-37-587_ba5751d05cc6c062.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa058e96f5b310011724e34?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn43@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-42-155_a15ecd427a052680.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa05ac26f5b310011724e44?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn67@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-44-258_a190b31607bb746c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa05e7669331a0011bc6ccc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn78@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-52-765_cf25ff463afa5942.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa065c46f5b310011724e81?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn27@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-39-603_6643a76e7a75ba8e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa084711df1d50018218732?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn45@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-51-198_0be09fe8ebfebe33.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=URZMKNnlJBw:1wAh_DK10xc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn1@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-54-994_692288d7c1d97097.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=URZMKNnlJBw:1wAh_DK10xc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn13@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-36-854_551f5c0a3e044b36.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=URZMKNnlJBw:1wAh_DK10xc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn89@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-55-606_81b3107db5e15680.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/URZMKNnlJBw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn84@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-47-065_c2286fbc932e11fb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490592},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"Harris County, Texas, to close 9 of 10 drive-thru voting sites, fearing Republican efforts to invalidate votes","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/harris-county-closes-9-of-10-drive-thru-voting-sites-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa0d24b69331a0011bc6e4e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"harris county votes\" height=\"2010\" width=\"4020\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Demonstrator Gina Dusterhoft holds up a sign as she walks to join others standing across the street from the federal courthouse in Houston, Monday, Nov. 2, 2020, before a hearing in federal court involving drive-thru ballots cast in Harris County.\n<p class=\"copyright\">David J. Phillip/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Harris County Clerk Chris Hollins said he \"cannot in good faith encourage voters to cast their votes in [drive-thru] tents if that puts their votes at risk.\"</li>\n<li>Accordingly, Hollins said he was closing nine of 10 drive-thru voting locations. Only the Houston Toyota Center will remain open.</li>\n<li>The move comes after Texas Republicans had sued to invalidate ballots cast at drive-thru voting sites.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Harris County, Texas, is shuttering nine of its 10 drive-thru voting sites on Election Day, County Clerk Chris Hollins said Monday night, a move that comes after Texas Republicans had fought, unsuccessfully, to have more than 120,000 ballots cast via vehicle thrown out.</p><p>While insisting the sites were legal, Hollins, a Democrat, cited ongoing litigation as a reason for caution.</p><p>\"My job is to protect the right to vote for all Harris County voters, and that includes those who are going to vote on Election Day,\" he said on Twitter. \"I cannot in good faith encourage voters to cast their votes in [drive-thru] tents if that puts their vote at risk.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Chris Hollins  (@CGHollins) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1323480528885063680?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 3, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Earlier on Monday, US Judge Andrew Hanen rejected a Republican lawsuit that had sought to invalidate ballots that had already been cast at drive-thru voting centers, admonishing the plaintiffs for bringing the case so close to Election Day.</p><p>However, Hanen \"ordered county officials to maintain a registry of the votes that were cast at drive-thru polling places in case the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals came to a different conclusion,\" <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/texas-drive-thru-ballots-case-ruling-federal-judge-throws-out-2020-11\">Insider's Jacob Shamsian</a> reported.</p><p>\"I find that when you balance the harms, you've got to weigh in favor of counting the votes,\" Hanen said. However, \"If I were voting tomorrow . . . I would not vote in a drive-through just out of my concern as to whether that's legal or not,\" he added.</p><p>Rep. Steve Toth and several right-wing activists then <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/texas-drive-thru-ballots-case-ruling-federal-judge-throws-out-2020-11\">appealed the decision</a> and filed an emergency motion, limiting their arguments to whether drive-thru voting should be allowed, specifically, on Election Day.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Chris Hollins  (@CGHollins) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1323480531309309952?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 3, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>In their emergency motion, the plaintiffs maintained that drive-thru voting \"cheapens the electoral process\" and detracts \"from the traditional respect for Election Day.\" In addition, they argue that the state legislature restricts this form of voting to the physically handicapped or in cases where voting in person \"would create a likelihood of injuring the voter's health\"; they insisted that COVID-19 does not pose such a threat.</p><p>At issue is whether drive-thru voting tents had constituted \"buildings\" under Texas law. To be sure votes on Tuesday are counted, Hollins said he would only be opening one drive-thru location, at the Houston Toyota Center, which arguably fits the more conservative definition.</p><div border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=1Cz87W0yYzc:VPef83RzJdk:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1Cz87W0yYzc:VPef83RzJdk:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/1Cz87W0yYzc\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 03 Nov 2020 05:07:56 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fa0d2401df1d5001821879d?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"ef18690624be5ee51439d98da2b7148e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn43@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-35-404_81009208100eb9b1.webp","destWidth":3573,"destHeight":2680,"sourceBytes":298476,"destBytes":298476,"author":"insider@insider.com (Lauren Frias,Charles Davis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fa0d24b69331a0011bc6e4e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn91@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-48-114_b8af25f8dae2e093.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1Cz87W0yYzc:VPef83RzJdk:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn70@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-45-704_3250cd622ee322b0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1Cz87W0yYzc:VPef83RzJdk:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn96@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-40-470_b52e93ad8659780a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1Cz87W0yYzc:VPef83RzJdk:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn22@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-53-007_9bc99f10833155fb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/1Cz87W0yYzc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn63@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-40-906_032e156e6994a78c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490477},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"'Fortnite' is getting major updates for the launch of the PlayStation 5 and next-gen Xbox consoles — here's what you can expect at launch","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/fortnite-playstation-5-and-next-gen-xbox-what-to-expect-2020-11","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7b4cbc282c500018c789e3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Xbox Series X and PlayStation 5\" height=\"1957\" width=\"3600\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   Left: The Xbox Series X. Right: The PlayStation 5. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Microsoft/Sony</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\"> \n <li><strong>One of the biggest games in the world, \"Fortnite,\" will be available at launch on the PlayStation 5 and next-gen Xbox consoles.<br /></strong></li> \n <li><strong>The next-gen versions of \"Fortnite\" are more than \"tweaked last-gen builds,\" \"Fortnite\" maker Epic Games says, \"but new native ones to harness the power of the new consoles.\"</strong></li> \n <li><strong>To that end, the game will run at a higher resolution than ever before (4K) and it'll also run smoother than ever before (with its framerate locked to 60 frames per second).&nbsp;</strong></li> \n <li><strong>Not only that, but the game will be playable across platforms — PS5 and next-gen Xbox owners will be able to play with \"Fortnite\" players on Xbox One, PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, PC, Mac, and Android — and all progress and unlocks will carry forward.</strong></li> \n <li><strong><a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.</a></strong></li> \n</ul>\n<p>When next-gen game consoles from Sony's PlayStation and Microsoft's Xbox arrive this holiday season, one of the world's biggest games will run right out of the gate: \"Fortnite\" is coming to PlayStation 5 and next-gen Xbox consoles at launch.</p>\n<p>\"Fortnite\" maker Epic Games <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fortnite-playstation-5-xbox-series-x-launch-2020-5\">announced as much earlier this year</a>, and now we know exactly what updates the game will get on the next-gen consoles.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>As you might imagine, the game will look better and run smoother on every new console — from the Xbox Series S, with its lower price point and lower horsepower, to the PlayStation 5 — but the game sees the most gains on the $500 Xbox Series X and PlayStation 5.</p>\n<p>On the highest-end consoles from Sony and Microsoft, \"Fortnite\" will display in a 4K resolution that's locked to 60 frames per second, <a href=\"https://www.epicgames.com/fortnite/en-US/news/day-1-ready-fortnite-arrives-next-week-on-xbox-series-x-s-and-ps5\">Epic Games revealed on Monday</a>. On the Xbox Series S, the resolution maxes out at 1080p, but keeps the framerate locked to 60 frames per second. And on every next-gen console, the game is said to load much faster.</p>\n<p>Because the PlayStation 5 has a variety of unique features separate from the two upcoming Xbox consoles, Epic is adding functionality to the PS5 version of \"Fortnite\" that isn't coming anywhere else: For starters, you'll be able to jump into specific \"Fortnite\" game modes directly from the console home screen.</p>\n<p>\"'Fortnite' supports PS5's Activities, starting with the ability to go straight into the Battle Royale Lobby with either Solo, Duos, or Squads selected,\" Epic's blog post said. \"Once in the Lobby, choose to queue up for your selected mode!\"</p>\n<p>The PS5 version of \"Fortnite\" also takes advantage of the new haptic triggers on the PS5 gamepad — triggers that offer vibration functionality, but also add more nuanced feedback to players.</p>\n<p>\"In addition to general vibration support,\" Epic's post said, \"we've integrated haptic trigger feedback for ranged weapons on the new DualSense controller.\" What this means in game, according to Epic, is the PlayStation 5 gamepad, \"makes it feel like you're holding the Suppressed SMG or Bolt-Action Sniper Rifle.\"</p>\n<p>The next-gen versions of \"Fortnite\" will still allow cross-platform multiplayer with friends on other platforms. Moreover, any progress you've made or unlocks you've purchased on Xbox One will transfer to next-gen Xbox consoles, and the same goes for PS4 players moving to PS5.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>All next-gen versions of \"Fortnite\" will be available at launch on the respective platforms: November 10 for Xbox Series S and Series X players, and November 12 for PlayStation 5 players.</p>\n<p><em><strong>Got a tip?</strong>&nbsp;Contact Business Insider senior correspondent Ben Gilbert via email (<a href=\"mailto:bgilbert@businessinsider.com\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">bgilbert@businessinsider.com</a>),</em><em>&nbsp;or Twitter DM (<a href=\"https://twitter.com/RealBenGilbert\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">@realbengilbert</a>). We can keep sources anonymous. Use a non-work device to reach out. PR pitches by email only, please.</em></p>\n<div class=\"read-original\">\n Read the original article on \n <a 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"Black Friday 2020: The best early deals from Amazon, Best Buy, and The Home Depot, plus everything you need to know for November 27","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/black-friday-deals","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f90785c212113001873ff57?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Black Friday Date 2020 2x1\" height=\"834\" width=\"1668\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Nearly every major retailer will offer deals and exclusive offers throughout the month of November for Black Friday.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alyssa Powell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Black Friday&#160;is one of the most anticipated shopping events of the year, and this year's Black Friday is shaping up to be unlike any that came before it.&#160;</p><p>Several stores, like&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-black-friday-deals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Amazon</a>,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-buy-early-black-friday-sale-ad-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Best Buy,</a>&#160;and&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/home-depot-black-friday-deals-preview-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Home Depot</a>, are kicking off their sales early in-store and online. Which means you can snag some Black Friday-caliber bargains weeks ahead of the sale.</p><p>Below, learn everything you need to know about Black Friday 2020, such as the important dates to know, the best deals available now, where to shop, and what our team of expert product reviewers expect to see this November during <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/black-friday-2020\">Black Friday</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cyber-monday-deals\">Cyber Monday</a>.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><h2>The best <strong style=\"color: #000000;\">early </strong>Black Friday deals available now</h2><div id=\"ProductCard_5d35e177100a24190c405c8a\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5d35e177100a24190c405c8a&type=medium&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5cf00a8911e20546855251d7\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5cf00a8911e20546855251d7&type=medium&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5e3b0142d9db1d0e06726177\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e3b0142d9db1d0e06726177&type=medium&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5f83b0ba851d5a0c2f272f35\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f83b0ba851d5a0c2f272f35&type=medium&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5ddd62e0fd9db25966646f2c\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5ddd62e0fd9db25966646f2c&type=medium&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5f852f12851d5a01642e6c54\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f852f12851d5a01642e6c54&type=medium&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><h2>What is Black Friday?&#160;</h2><p>Black Friday is an annual sales event that traditionally happens at the end of November and, historically, marks the beginning of the holiday shopping season. The event is one of the biggest shopping holidays of the year — sales are so high that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-is-it-called-black-friday-2018-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the day can push a retailer into \"the black,\" or solvency</a>.</p><p>Shoppers can expect thousands of deals to crop up on the days leading up to and following the big sales event. That said, many retailers often wait until the big day to drop the best deals.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">Is Black Friday 2020 cancelled?</strong></h2><p>No, but it will be unlike any Black Friday that came before it. This year, Black Friday will be longer and more online than ever.</p><p>Nearly every major retailer will offer deals and exclusive offers throughout the month of November, if they haven't started already.&#160;</p><p>With the ongoing pandemic, the in-store Black Friday experience will look a lot different than in previous years. It's hard to imagine seeing the deluge of people scrambling for doorbuster deals happening this year with safety restrictions in place.</p><h2>When is Black Friday 2020?</h2><p>Black Friday is always the Friday after Thanksgiving. This year, Black Friday falls on November 27.&#160;</p><p>However, due to increased online shopping and subsequent supply-chain delays related to the COVID-19 pandemic, several storefronts<strong style=\"color: #000000;\">,</strong> including <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Ft.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Walmart </a>and <a href=\"https://shop-links.co/1721541128379073190\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Best Buy</a>, have augmented their schedules. For instance, Best Buy launched its \"Black Friday\" sale alongside Amazon Prime Day. The electronics retailer decided to begin its sale early this year \"to help shoppers start their shopping season early — and safely.\"&#160;</p><h2>What time does Black Friday start?</h2><p>Technically speaking, Black Friday starts at 12:01 a.m. local time for online retailers. However, Black Friday sales start whenever each retailer decides their sales will go live.</p><p>From what we've seen so far, several retailers will be releasing new deals every week in 2020.&#160;</p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-black-friday-deals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Amazon</a>:</strong> While Amazon hasn't released when it will release its official, wide-ranging Black Friday sale, it's offering several one-day offers during the lead-up. Last year, Amazon's deals started online at midnight on November 22.</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-buy-black-friday-deals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Best Buy</a></strong>: Stores will be closed Thanksgiving Day, but the retailer is running its 'Prep for the Holidays Black Friday' sale for the whole month of November.&#160;</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/gamestop-black-friday-deals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Gamestop</a></strong>: While Gamestop has yet to announce its Black Friday sale dates, we do know that all stores will be closed for Thanksgiving Day and that the retailer is planning to offer deals ahead of November 28.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/home-depot-black-friday-deals-preview-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Home Depot</strong>:</a> The Home Depot's Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales run from November 6 through December 2. <br>Its early preview is already available to view on The Home Depot app.&#160;</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kohls-black-friday-deals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Kohl's</a></strong>: Stores will be closed Thanksgiving Day, but the retailer's sale is slated to start on Black Friday, November 28.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/macys-black-friday-deals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Macy's</strong></a>: Macy's is currently mum on when it will kick off its Black Friday sale. Last year, Macy's&#160;opened from 5 p.m. Thanksgiving Day to 2 a.m. November 29 of last year. They reopened at 6 a.m. November 29 of last year.</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=1237&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fshop.nordstrom.com%2F%3Forigin%3Dtab-logo&u1=1603305111588apyg1isz5|xid:fr1603305115335ije305115335ije\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-orig-url=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=1237&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fshop.nordstrom.com%2F%3Forigin%3Dtab-logo&u1=1603305111588apyg1isz5588apyg1isz5\" data-ml-id=\"7\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1603305115335ije\" data-uri=\"3fc9f7b51a120123dc87432b3d235ad5\">Nordstrom</a>:</strong> Last year, stores opened at 10 a.m. November 29 and online sales started on November 27. This year, we expect to see Nordstrom take a more online approach.&#160;</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/target-black-friday-deals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Target</a></strong>: The company is offering new deals every week of November for Black Friday this year, with weekly ads dropping each Thursday. The first ad will be released on October 29.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/walmart-black-friday-deals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Walmart</strong></a>: Walmart is holding 'Black Friday Deals for Days' events this year. Three events are taking place starting as early as November 4 both online and in stores, with a few online-only sales.&#160;&#160;</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wayfair-black-friday-deals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Wayfair</a>:</strong> Last year, Wayfair sales began online at 9 a.m. ET November 22.&#160;</li></ul><h2>How long do Black Friday sales last?</h2><p>Don't be fooled by the name that suggests it's a single day. It's most definitely not. It's more like a shopping season that begins in early November.&#160;</p><p>Black Friday sales generally start days or weeks in advance of the actual shopping event and continue on until <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cyber-monday-deals\">Cyber Monday</a>. Better yet, some retailers hold their deals until well after both events to further boost the entire December shopping season.</p><h2>What should you buy on Black Friday?&#160;</h2><p>Since it falls a few weeks before the gift-giving season, Black Friday provides excellent opportunities to buy — and save on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-gift-ideas\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">all your holiday gifts</a> &#160;— before the last-minute rush.&#160;</p><p>It's nearly guaranteed that you'll get great value for your money on certain products during Black Friday — but some tend to see better discounts at other times of the year. If you go in knowing what you're looking for, you're less likely to be ripped off by a fancy-looking coupon or to spend money on products you don't need.</p><p>Shoppers can expect tons of great deals — including so-called \"doorbusters\" — online before and the days following Black Friday. During the event, prices will drop to all-time lows, often beating out prices we see over the course of the year. The sale covers every product category: tech, home and kitchen, fashion, and smart home.&#160;</p><p>This Black Friday, shoppers should expect to see similar offers to the ones we saw on Amazon Prime Day, except more wide-ranging.</p><h3>We recommend focusing on the following product categories if you want the best deals:&#160;</h3><ul><li>TVs</li><li>Smart home devices</li><li>Gaming consoles and video games</li><li>Kitchen appliances</li></ul><p>Historically, Black Friday has been a great time to purchase big-ticket electronics — especially larger TVs. Whether you're looking for a top-of-the-line Samsung set or LG OLED, or a budget-friendly TCL or Hisense model, Black Friday will likely deliver several deals.</p><p>Much like Amazon Prime Day, we expect to see tons of discounts on smart home products. We'll likely see Amazon Echo products drop to their lowest prices ever, plus several discounts and bundles on Google's recently released products.</p><p>Black Friday happens&#160;<em>after</em> the latest Xbox and Playstation consoles are released. While we're unlikely to see any markdowns on the consoles, we may see a few bundles crop up. We will likely see modest discounts on games for all consoles, and huge bundles for last-generation consoles.&#160;</p><p>If you're looking for a kitchen upgrade, Black Friday is a great time to shop. We'll likely see discounts on Instant Pot pressure cookers, KitchenAid appliances, pots and pans, plus everything else you'll want for the upcoming holiday season.</p><p>Of course, the deals found during Black Friday are incredibly wide-ranging. While we expect there to be several deals on diapers, toilet paper, or other household essentials and toiletries, please be careful not to over-stock on supplies during a pandemic.</p><h2>Is Black Friday or Cyber Monday better?</h2><p>It's complicated, and it matters much less this year.</p><p>For those unfamiliar, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cyber-monday-deals\">Cyber Monday</a> traditionally comes three days after Black Friday, or the following Monday after. However, we've seen Black Friday and Cyber Monday slowly merge and expand to a weeklong, or even a monthlong affair. Different products receive better discounts on each day, and the deals that each retailer offers will vary.</p><p>This year, with most Americans shopping online, it's more critical for shoppers to know where and what time to shop, not what day.&#160;</p><p>A good rule of thumb to follow: If you think you see a good deal, (e.g. one we recommend) create the order as soon as possible. While you can always cancel or return a product, it's impossible to take advantage of an inactive, or expired deal.</p><p>Suppose you purchase a discounted product during Black Friday and see a more significant markdown at another retailer come Cyber Monday. Don't sweat it.</p><p>You can ask the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stores-that-price-match\">original storefront to match the price</a>&#160;(some automatically refund you the difference), or you can return or cancel the order, then place a new order with the better price. Some orders won't even ship during the weekend, which makes it easy to cancel orders.</p><p>For those who can shop in-person during Black Friday, we've found that it's better to shop on Black Friday in these situations:</p><ul><li>For expensive products</li><li>For major stores</li><li>For this year's products</li><li>If you plan to shop in stores (if it's available in your area)</li></ul><p>It should go without saying, but this year's in-store experience will be a lot different from the one last year. If you so choose to shop Black Friday in-person, make sure to read up on the safety guidelines provided by each storefront.</p><h2>What stores have Black Friday deals?&#160;</h2><p>Outside of a few notable exceptions like REI, nearly every major retailer and direct-to-consumer company will offer markdowns during the event. Shoppers should expect deals from <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Ft.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Walmart</a>, <a href=\"https://shop-links.co/1721541128379073190\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Best Buy</a>, <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fdeals.dell.com%2Fen-us%2Fen-us\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Dell</a>, <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/?tag=biip_101320_amazon-prime-day-2020-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Amazon</a>, <a href=\"https://adorama.rfvk.net/c/196318/51926/1036?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.adorama.com%2F%3Fgclid%3DCj0KCQjwuL_8BRCXARIsAGiC51AE7LddV14xtL0lGSAfSvcpbcWy4wX4nZrXJJVGhn9ED7ZW6C03BZkaAvB4EALw_wcB%26gclsrc%3Daw.ds%26utm_source%3Dnmpi-google-brand\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Adorama</a>, <a href=\"https://adorama.rfvk.net/c/196318/51926/1036?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.adorama.com%2F%3Fgclid%3DCj0KCQjwuL_8BRCXARIsAGiC51AE7LddV14xtL0lGSAfSvcpbcWy4wX4nZrXJJVGhn9ED7ZW6C03BZkaAvB4EALw_wcB%26gclsrc%3Daw.ds%26utm_source%3Dnmpi-google-brand\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Lowe's</a>, <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.homedepot.com%2Ft.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Home Depot</a>, and more.</p><p>As we do every Black Friday, we are sifting through all of the offers and rounding up the best deals from your favorite retailers.&#160;</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">Will there be Black Friday shipping delays?</strong></h2><p>Shipping delays and major shopping holidays go hand in hand, and this year is no exception.&#160;Experts suggest that consumers may see low inventory problems and shipping, during <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/holiday-shopping-2020-why-consumers-should-shop-early-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Black Friday and the weeks following</a>.&#160;</p><p>While we do expect shipping delays, several retailers, including Walmart, Target, and Best Buy, are hoping to alleviate some of that stress by offering in-store pickup and contactless curbside pickup. This means shoppers can grab their orders at a nearby location if the store has it in stock.&#160;</p><h2>When do Black Friday ads come out?</h2><p>Every year, shoppers eagerly await Black Friday advertising to get a sneak peek at the deals each retailer will over. Shoppers use these \"ad scans\" to help create their Black Friday game plan.</p><p>While there isn't a release schedule available, a smattering of retailers has already posted their advertising online, the most notable being Best Buy and Walmart. We'll update this section to include all of the available ad scans as soon as they become available.</p><p>Here are the most important ad scans currently available:&#160;</p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fstore%2Fdirectoryirectory\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Walmart</a></strong>: To find the ad scan, first find your local Walmart via the local directory. Once you get to the \"Store Overview\" page, find the \"Weekly Ad\" section.</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://shop-links.co/1722280938175850261\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"0ce0cca8376dd9335479b9a2136f4fca\">Best Buy</a></strong>: Be on the lookout for the \"Deal available today\" banner for markdowns you can take advantage of now. These specific discounts end Sunday, November 1.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/home-depot-black-friday-deals-preview-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Home Depot</strong></a>: From November 6 through December 2, <a data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1604076421417hgg\" data-uri=\"e90948413952d1b6464a7d3c1b768219\">holiday decor</a>, and more.</li></ul><h2>How we select the best Black Friday deals</h2><ul><li>We only choose products that meet our high standard of coverage and that we've either used ourselves or researched carefully.</li><li>We'll compare the prices among top retailers such as Amazon, Best Buy, Target, and Walmart and include only the deals that are better than all others offered (not including promotional discounts that come from using certain credit cards).&#160;</li><li>All deals will be at least 20% off, with the occasional exception for products that are rarely discounted or provide an outsize value.</li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/CiluMrbVQtY\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 02 Nov 2020 20:43:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f909365abcd0c0018d68e85?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"246b05f158b7f6f0b6bf34319f0b3463","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn55@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-34-379_3517fd8894cd028b.webp","destWidth":1668,"destHeight":1251,"sourceBytes":33962,"destBytes":33962,"author":"tbufete@businessinsider.com (Tercius Bufete)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f90785c212113001873ff57?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn67@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-46-860_5e0a412218af513d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=CiluMrbVQtY:XICMttBBavY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn66@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-48-080_a02403075a53d31a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=CiluMrbVQtY:XICMttBBavY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn47@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-39-144_6cb2935b5d3eeb9b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=CiluMrbVQtY:XICMttBBavY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn85@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-54-459_85085e6392963566.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/CiluMrbVQtY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn82@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-55-614_2566de23d00cac04.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490589},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"Only 10 presidents have not won reelection, and polling suggests Trump could join them","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-join-10-presidents-who-didnt-win-reelection-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa084df1df1d50018218735?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty/Chip Somodevilla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Only 10 incumbent presidents in US history have won their party's nomination but failed to win reelection.&#160;</li>\n<li>Election polling has suggested Trump's chances of reelection have been dwindling for months, as voters also express disapproval of his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic.</li>\n<li>Trump is trailing former Vice President Joe Biden in the national polls, as well as in a number of key battleground states.</li>\n<li>Though nothing is guaranteed, polling suggests Trump could join a short list of incumbents who failed to win a second term.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>In recent US history, incumbent presidents have often enjoyed a <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/01/07/incumbent-presidents-usually-get-more-popular-when-they-run-reelection-will-trump/\">significant boost in popularity</a> while running for reelection.&#160;&#160;</p><p>This has not been the case for President Donald Trump. When Trump officially launched his reelection bid in June 2019, his approval rating was around 43%, <a href=\"https://news.gallup.com/interactives/185273/presidential-job-approval-center.aspx\">according to Gallup</a>. Trump's approval rating has barely fluctuated since then, with short-lived gains here and there.&#160;</p><p>Polling from Gallup in <a href=\"https://news.gallup.com/poll/323234/national-satisfaction-rises-election-nears.aspx\">September and October</a> shows Trump's approval rating fluctuated between 42% and 46%, averaging 44%.</p><p>For months, election polling has suggested Trump's chances of reelection have been dwindling during the economic recession and the president's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-chaotic-coronavirus-response-has-created-void-china-is-filling-2020-4\">disastrous response</a> to the COVID-19 pandemic.</p><p>Trump is trailing former Vice President Joe Biden by <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/where-biden-trump-stand-polls-one-day-out-election-day-2020-11\">a significant margin</a> in the national polls.&#160;</p><p>The president is also behind Biden in crucial battleground states with large numbers of electoral votes such as Michigan, Wisconsin, Pennsylvania, and Florida, per FiveThirtyEight, all states he narrowly carried in his stunning upset win in 2016.</p><p>Simply put, Trump could join the short list of incumbent presidents who weren't reelected.&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tJohn Adams (1797-1801)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c868f69331a0011bc684b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"John Adams.\" height=\"2890\" width=\"3853\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>John Adams.\n<p class=\"copyright\">The Print Collector/Print Collector/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>John Adams, the nation's first vice president and second president, failed to win a second term in the 1800 election.</p><p>Adams, a Federalist, was defeated by Thomas Jefferson, a Democratic-Republican.&#160;</p><p>The election marked the first peaceful transfer of power between members of two political parties. Though Adams wanted to remain president, he accepted the results of the election and stepped down, establishing an important precedent for the US. He did not attend Jefferson's inauguration.</p><p>Adams faced a foreign policy crisis with France during his presidency, known as the Qausi-War, and signed <a href=\"https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/americanexperience/features/adams-alien-and-seditions-act/\">the controversial Alien and Sedition Acts</a>. The acts, which gave the government broad authority to deport foreign-born residents and punish critics, are often cited as a major factor in Adam's loss in the election.&#160;</p>\n\tJohn Quincy Adams (1825-1829)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa05ee269331a0011bc6cce?format=jpeg\" alt=\"john quincy adams\" height=\"1544\" width=\"2059\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A portrait of John Quincy Adams.\n<p class=\"copyright\">National Archive/Newsmakers/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>John Quincy Adams, the son of President John Adams, did not win reelection in 1828. He was defeated by Andrew Jackson.&#160;</p><p>Adams became president in 1824 despite Jackson receiving more electoral votes. No candidate had won a majority of the electoral votes, so the House of Representatives was left to decide. The House ultimately elected Adams.</p><p>Adams faced fierce opposition from Jacksonians (supporters of Jackson) in Congress while president, and had few major accomplishments during his tenure. He lost badly to Jackson in 1828.</p><p>His career in politics was far from over, however, and Adams would later serve as a congressman from 1831 to 1848.</p>\n\tMartin Van Buren (1837-1841)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa0635b69331a0011bc6ce6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Martin Van Buren.\" height=\"3568\" width=\"4758\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Martin Van Buren.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Universal History Archive/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Martin Van Buren lost the 1840 election to William Henry Harrison.&#160;</p><p>Van Buren's tenure was plagued from the start by a financial crisis, and his unpopularity was compounded by an expensive war with the Seminole Indians in Florida.</p><p>He lost by a landslide in 1840, with Harrison winning <a href=\"https://www.britannica.com/event/United-States-presidential-election-of-1840\">234 electoral votes</a> and Van Buren just 60.</p>\n\tGrover Cleveland (1885-1889)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa0668991178a0019b3dc26?format=jpeg\" alt=\"grover cleveland\" height=\"383\" width=\"510\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.loc.gov/item/2014648289/\" target=\"_blank\">Library of Congress</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Grover Cleveland lost the election of 1888 to Benjamin Harrison.</p><p>Cleveland won the popular vote by <a href=\"https://www.britannica.com/event/United-States-presidential-election-of-1888\">more than 100,000 votes</a> but ultimately lost to Harrison via the electoral college. It was just the second time in US history that a candidate lost the popular vote but still won the presidency.&#160;&#160;</p><p>But Cleveland ran for president again in 1892, defeating Harrison and winning another term. Cleveland is still counted among the incumbent presidents who won their party's nomination but lost their bid for reelection, however.&#160;</p>\n\tBenjamin Harrison (1889-1893)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa06d4b91178a0019b3dc55?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Benjamin Harrison\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Benjamin Harrison\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Benjamin Harrison defeated Grover Cleveland in the 1888 election, despite losing the popular vote.&#160;</p><p>Harrison would only serve one term, however, after losing to Cleveland in the 1892 election.&#160;</p><p>During his presidency, Harrison's <a href=\"https://www.britannica.com/topic/McKinley-Tariff-Act\">support for tariffs</a> drove up costs for consumers, which was unpopular. This, among other factors, contributed to Harrison's political demise.&#160;</p>\n\tWilliam Howard Taft (1909-1913)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa07c9569331a0011bc6d8f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"William Howard Taft\" height=\"1517\" width=\"2022\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>William Howard Taft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Popperfoto/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>William Howard Taft was defeated by Woodrow Wilson in the 1912 election, joining the ranks of incumbent presidents who did not win reelection.&#160;</p><p>Taft, a Republican, was deeply unpopular and faced a divided party.</p><p>Though he'd been close with his predecessor, President Teddy Roosevelt, Taft's approach to policy drove them apart.</p><p>Roosevelt challenged Taft for the Republican party presidential nomination in 1912, but the former president ultimately lost to his successor and ran as a third-party candidate.&#160;</p><p>Taft suffered a humiliating defeat, earning less of the popular and electoral vote than <a href=\"https://www.britannica.com/event/United-States-presidential-election-of-1912\">both Wilson and Roosevelt.</a> But his career in public service was not totally over, and Taft later went on to become Chief Justice of the US.&#160;</p>\n\tHerbert Hoover (1929-1933)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec657ea3f73702a962cae86?format=jpeg\" alt=\"franklin delano roosevelt herbert hoover\" height=\"1496\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Franklin D. Roosevelt, right, leaves the White House with President Herbert Hoover on his Inauguration day in 1933.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/franklin-delano-roosevelt-the-32nd-president-of-the-united-news-photo/3425457?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">Topical Press Agency/Getty</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Herbert Hoover was defeated by Franklin D. Roosevelt in the 1932 election.&#160;</p><p>Hoover was president at the onset of the Great Depression, and failed to rise to the task of addressing the economic calamity.&#160;</p><p>Roosevelt crushed Hoover in the election, winning the popular vote by <a href=\"https://www.britannica.com/event/United-States-presidential-election-of-1932\">more than seven million votes</a>. Hoover earned just 59 electoral votes to Roosevelt's 472.</p>\n\tGerald Ford (1974-1977)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa07f741df1d50018218718?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gerald Ford\" height=\"1801\" width=\"2402\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Gerald R. Ford.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Don Carl STEFFEN/Gamma-Rapho/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Gerald Ford lost the 1976 election to Jimmy Carter after coming to power during one of the most tumultuous decades of the 20th century for the US.</p><p>Ford was never actually elected president.</p><p>He became commander-in-chief after President Richard Nixon resigned while facing impeachment over the Watergate scandal. Ford was the first unelected president in US history.&#160;</p><p>Ford contended with <a href=\"https://www.history.com/topics/1970s/energy-crisis\">an energy crisis</a> and major economic woes during his short presidency.&#160;</p><p>Carter defeated Ford by a little over 1.6 million votes, <a href=\"https://www.britannica.com/event/United-States-presidential-election-of-1976/The-general-election-campaign\">earning 297 electoral college votes to Ford's 240.</a></p>\n\tJimmy Carter (1977-1981)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa081d21df1d50018218724?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jimmy Carter at The Tribune.\" height=\"3416\" width=\"4554\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jimmy Carter at The Tribune.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Keystone-France/Gamma-Keystone via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Jimmy Carter was defeated by Ronald Reagan in the 1980 election.</p><p>Carter, who'd come to Washington as an outsider after previously serving as governor of Georgia, struggled to get things done and his management of the economy made him deeply unpopular.&#160;</p><p>He also faced one of the biggest international crises for the US in the modern era: the Iranian hostage crisis. Dozens of hostages were taken by Iranian students at the US embassy in Tehran. The US launched a <a href=\"https://www.britannica.com/event/Operation-Eagle-Claw\">disastrous military operation</a> meant to rescue the hostages in April 1980 that resulted in a helicopter crash and the deaths of eight service members.&#160;</p><p>The hostages were eventually released. The crisis lasted for 444 days, ending on January, 20, 1981, the same day Reagan was inaugurated.&#160;</p><p>Carter's handling of the hostage crisis is often cited as a major reason Reagan won an overwhelming victory in 1980.&#160;</p><p>Though he struggled as commander-in-chief, Carter has had a successful post-presidency and is widely admired. He was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2002.&#160;</p>\n\tGeorge H.W. Bush (1989-1993)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed602ed5af6cc60ec418cf6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"George H.W. Bush\" height=\"1993\" width=\"2893\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>In this Dec. 20, 1989, file photo, President George H.W. Bush addresses the nation on television from the Oval Office in Washington as he explains his decision to deploy American troops to Panama.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Barry Thumma/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>George H.W. Bush lost the 1992 election to Bill Clinton.&#160;</p><p>Bush, a war hero who was also a former vice president and ex-CIA director, struggled to overcome the energy of Clinton's campaign.&#160;</p><p>An economic downturn at the time was also at the heart of Bush's unsuccessful effort to win reelection. Despite guiding the US through tumultuous global events, such as the collapse of the Soviet Union, Bush was unable to garner the support necessary to overcome Clinton in the general election.</p><p>Bush is the most recent incumbent president who won his party's nomination but failed to win a second term.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on
