src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eCgJZShE6zA:9-lzvmwVn8Q:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eCgJZShE6zA:9-lzvmwVn8Q:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eCgJZShE6zA:9-lzvmwVn8Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eCgJZShE6zA:9-lzvmwVn8Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/eCgJZShE6zA\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 02 Nov 2020 21:41:04 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fa076e891178a0019b3dc96?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"219c09965c85b3a6d93e94fbcd0876e9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn84@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-35-649_5c83a772fe53eca9.webp","destWidth":1776,"destHeight":1332,"sourceBytes":119680,"destBytes":119680,"author":"insider@insider.com (John Haltiwanger)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fa076f969331a0011bc6d5f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn75@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-39-159_5b61bd74f26d14de.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eCgJZShE6zA:9-lzvmwVn8Q:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn61@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-45-514_a58b6ee26cd8bf14.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eCgJZShE6zA:9-lzvmwVn8Q:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn51@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-57-666_a10dc029f517dd98.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eCgJZShE6zA:9-lzvmwVn8Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn13@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-53-056_e904adb0116f5621.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/eCgJZShE6zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn38@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-47-585_b061da22ccff5c09.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490502},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"CDC: COVID-19 is more likely to be serious or deadly in pregnant women than other women of the same age","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pregnant-women-with-covid-19-more-likely-icu-cdc-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e4ebb2f043895771e7f3b63?format=jpeg\" alt=\"pregnant woman pregnancy expectant expecting first second third trimester fertile fertility mom mother parent maternity baby birth labor cox 4\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Crystal Cox/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Pregnant women with COVID-19 are more likely to be admitted into the intensive care unit, put on ventilators, need life support, and die than coronavirus patients who aren't pregnant, a CDC report found.</li>\n<li>Racial disparities existed too, with pregnant Hispanic women more likely to contract COVID-19 and Black women with the illness more likely to experience serious complications, whether or not they were pregnant.&#160;</li>\n<li>The findings add to past research showing COVID-19 can increase the risk of pregnancy complications, though the overall risks are still low.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Most pregnant women with COVID-19 fare well, but they are still at increased risk for serious complications when compared to nonpregnant women with the disease, a large <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/69/wr/mm6944e3.htm?s_cid=mm6944e3_w\">report</a> out of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found.&#160;</p><p>The analysis looked at data from about 400,000 15- to 44-year-old women who had symptomatic COVID-19 between late January and early October. They found that pregnant women were more likely to be admitted into the intensive care unit, put on ventilators, need life support, and even die than those who weren't pregnant.&#160;</p><p>Specifically, pregnant women with COVID-19 were nearly four times as likely to need ventilation and twice as likely to die than nonpregnant women with COVID-19 of the same age. Still, their overall risks for complications were low: 1.5% of pregnant women went to the ICU, 0.29% needed ventilation, 0.07 required life support, and 0.15% died.&#160;</p><p>The findings demonstrate how important it is for pregnant women and their families to take coronavirus transmission measures seriously. They could also inform how healthcare systems treat pregnant COVID-19 patients.&#160;</p><h2>Women of color were disproportionately affected by COVID-19 and negative outcomes&#160;</h2><p>In 2019, 24% of pregnant women were Hispanic and 51% were white. In the current analysis, 30% of the COVID-19 positive pregnant women were Hispanic and only 24% were white. Like past research, this finding suggests people of color are disproportionately susceptible to contracting COVID-19.&#160;</p><p>The report illuminated other racial disparities too, with pregnant Asian and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander women seeming to be at disproportionate risk of ICU admission, and non-Hispanic Black women, whether or not they were pregnant, having higher rates of death from COVID-19.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Marian Knight, the lead author <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/half-pregnant-women-in-uk-coronavirus-black-ethnic-minorities-2020-6\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"86e7adc1423d6c7969479b485ea24799\">of a UK study</a> that found more than half of pregnant women who were admitted to the hospital with COVID-19 were Black or from other minority ethnic groups, previously told Insider more qualitative research involving talking to women about their experiences is \"urgently needed.\"</p><p>That work, she said, will help discern what puts pregnant women of color at such risk for COVID-19, be it household arrangements, jobs that make physical distancing difficult, restricted access to healthcare, something else, or all of the above.&#160;</p><h2>In contrast to past research, the findings suggest pregnant women with COVID-19 are more likely to die than nonpregnant women with the illness&#160;</h2><p>The current report had some limitations, mostly related to incomplete data. For instance, providers may be more inclined to report more serious outcomes and some serious outcomes may not yet be seen.&#160;</p><p>Pregnant people's increased risk for serious outcomes could also be related to how pregnancy affects the body, for example by increasing heart rate and oxygen consumption, decreasing lung capacity, dampening the immune system, and raising the risk for blood clots, the authors write.</p><p>But the large number of women studied adds to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-pregnant-women-increased-risk-for-severe-coronavirus-cases-hospitalization-2020-6\">past research finding that pregnant women with COVID-1</a>9 are more likely to end up in the ICU and receive ventilation than nonpregnant women of the same age. It also finds pregnant women with COVID-19 are more likely to need life support and die than nonpregnant women, which past research didn't find.&#160;</p><p>pregnant women and their families should take precautions like limiting interactions with people who might have been exposed to the coronavirus, wearing a mask, practicing social distancing, frequently washing their hands, and staying up to date on their prenatal care visits, the authors write.&#160;</p><p>Because other research has shown pregnant women, whether or not they have COVID-19, are also <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/coronavirus-linked-high-rates-depression-anxiety-pregnant-women-new-moms-2020-6\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"dabdd807c9e0ed09b16c148a32308b0a\">at high risk for depressive and anxiety symptoms</a> during the pandemic, it's also critically important for them to seek support, whether from friends and family, online support groups, or a mental health provider.&#160;</p><p>\"There are going to be a lot of emotions, some of which are sadness, grief and the unknown,\" Dr. Jane van Dis, an OB-GYN who serves as medical director at the telemedicine network&#160;<a href=\"https://www.mavenclinic.com/\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"e40ed4c31a5377b21b0cb67f70f8d4b6\">Maven</a>, previously told Insider. \"Just know that connecting with people who are there to support women is essential for mental health.\"&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/pregnant-women-with-covid-19-more-likely-icu-cdc-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=u8Y9MWOSq9s:0I2WVk_uHQo:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=u8Y9MWOSq9s:0I2WVk_uHQo:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/u8Y9MWOSq9s\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 02 Nov 2020 20:52:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5ecd4766f34d051ec07ba8d8?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"4fdc563e1dee142dfd503ba7033ecfd3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn11@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-35-532_94a04d80bd71f525.webp","destWidth":2223,"destHeight":1667,"sourceBytes":56364,"destBytes":56364,"author":"amiller@businessinsider.com (Anna Medaris Miller)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5e4ebb2f043895771e7f3b63?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn95@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-39-392_3bf50a66fe78a04d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=u8Y9MWOSq9s:0I2WVk_uHQo:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn84@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-41-428_cbb7788406f84c9e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=u8Y9MWOSq9s:0I2WVk_uHQo:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn22@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-35-964_ce932ffa9fdf0fa7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=u8Y9MWOSq9s:0I2WVk_uHQo:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn54@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-58-197_8153a37704939cab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/u8Y9MWOSq9s":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn20@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-56-609_33adaa8963fa4d6f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490568},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"A 'blue wave' is historically better for the stock market than a 'red wave,' according to one Wall Street strategist","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/blue-wave-historically-better-for-stock-market-than-red-wave-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f74e5200ab50d00184ad6a4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"biden trump debate tv ratings\" height=\"1632\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>People sit and watch a broadcast of the first debate between President Donald Trump and Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden at The Abbey, with socially distanced outdoor seating, on September 29, 2020 in West Hollywood, California.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mario Tama/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Since the election of Franklin D Roosevelt in 1932, a Democratic \"blue wave\" election victory has always been better for the stock market than a Republican \"red wave\" sweep, according to research from Ed Yardeni.</strong></li><li><strong>During the six previous Democratic administrations, the S&#38;P 500 was up 56% on average, the strategist found.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>In comparison, during the three previous completely Republican administrations, the S&#38;P 500 was up 35% on average.</strong></li><li><strong>However, both parties are bested by a divided government, when stocks were up 60% on average.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestutm_source=msn.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=msn-slideshow&utm_campaign=bodyurl?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestce=markets&#38;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Visit the Business Insider homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>The stock market has historically performed better under a \"blue wave\" government administration as opposed to a \"red wave\" administration, according to research by market strategist Ed Yardeni.</p><p>In a note to clients Monday, Yardeni highlighted the historical performance of the S&#38;P 500 since the 1932 election of Franklin D. Roosevelt. In the six following periods when Democrats controlled both chambers of Congress and the White House, the benchmark US equity index returned an average of 56%.</p><p>The best \"blue wave\" performance came from the FDR administration, with the S&#38;P 500 netting a return of 113%, and the worst came during the Bill Clinton administration of the early 1990's when the index returned just 4.6%.</p><p>However, during periods of Republican control, something that's only happened three times since 1932, Yardeni found that the S&#38;P 500 returned an average of 35%.&#160;</p><p>The best \"red wave\" performance came from the George W. Bush administration of 2001-2006, with the S&#38;P 500 returning 58%. The worst \"red wave\" performance came from the Donald Trump administration of 2017-2018, with the S&#38;P 500 returning 12.8%, Yardeni found.&#160;</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stocks-to-buy-and-avoid-in-3-election-outcomes-stifel-2020-10?r=gr-sub\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Stifel asked its analysts to identify stocks most likely to be positively or negatively affected by the election results. Here are the dozens of stocks to buy or avoid in each of the 3 outcomes.</a></em></p><p>Still, according to Yardeni, there's one scenario when the market historically performed better than both a \"blue wave\" and \"red wave\" scenario: when the government was divided amongst both Republicans and Democrats.&#160;</p><p>On average, since the election of FDR, the S&#38;P 500 returned an average of 60% when one party controlled either Congress or The White House, but not both.&#160;</p><p>\"This suggests that gridlock is more bullish than the two unified alternatives, which are also bullish, but less so with Blue Waves more bullish than Red Waves,\" Yardeni said,&#160;</p><p>The common notion is that a gridlocked government prevents less meddling of the government in business affairs, which allows businesses to do what they do best: create jobs.&#160;</p><p>Or, according to Yardeni, could it be that who occupies the White House and Congress do not matter as much to the stock market as does the Fed?</p><p>\"I think so,\" Yardeni concluded.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa0695691178a0019b3dc40?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yardeni Research.JPG\" height=\"677\" width=\"1140\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Yardeni Research</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/blue-wave-historically-better-for-stock-market-than-red-wave-2020-11'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=zzqSbLeC4sA:HIKcIwcyqGs:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=zzqSbLeC4sA:HIKcIwcyqGs:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zzqSbLeC4sA:HIKcIwcyqGs:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=zzqSbLeC4sA:HIKcIwcyqGs:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zzqSbLeC4sA:HIKcIwcyqGs:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=zzqSbLeC4sA:HIKcIwcyqGs:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/zzqSbLeC4sA\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 02 Nov 2020 20:49:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fa0707569331a0011bc6d2d?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"142ca44df7c8c3a041da331c034a6ff7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn12@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-34-592_0279364444d25c84.webp","destWidth":1755,"destHeight":1316,"sourceBytes":100570,"destBytes":100570,"author":"mfox@businessinsider.com (Matthew Fox)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f74e5200ab50d00184ad6a4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn58@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-37-080_c1fee2aa6c2b1dcb.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa0695691178a0019b3dc40?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn47@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-58-757_7cd66c30e061e183.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zzqSbLeC4sA:HIKcIwcyqGs:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn91@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-43-718_1e13f2573023a1ae.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zzqSbLeC4sA:HIKcIwcyqGs:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn30@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-51-066_3d62e87f8b7ff6ef.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zzqSbLeC4sA:HIKcIwcyqGs:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn24@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-45-132_42c2d413fdf11ff8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/zzqSbLeC4sA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn29@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-54-563_5a0e060d7c6c37f7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490652},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"Stocks face a tougher climb in 2021 due to 'inevitable hangover of policy,' top Wall Street strategist says","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-outlook-federal-reserve-monetary-support-fundamentals-rally-strategist-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa0598b69331a0011bc6cac?format=jpeg\" alt=\"worried trader\" height=\"1499\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">BRYAN R. SMITH/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Stock valuations were already outpacing the economy in 2019, and the coronavirus pandemic only exacerbated the issue. </strong></li><li><strong>That poses a risk to the market's climb in 2021, Seema Shah, chief strategist at Principal Global Investors, said in a <a href=\"https://blog.principal.com/2020/10/28/short-and-sharp-2020-the-year-when-nothing-really-changed-for-markets/\">blog post</a>.</strong></li><li><strong>Fundamentals and valuations continue to play second fiddle to the Federal Reserve's unprecedented policy backstop, Shah said, but that support will eventually need to be pulled back.</strong></li><li><strong>Monetary policy is reaching its limit, and once the economy returns to pre-pandemic levels of activity, the central bank will then need to focus on the US's massive debt pile.</strong></li><li><strong>The second stage of the US recovery \"will involve dealing with the inevitable hangover of policy, debt levels, and dependency on low rates,\" Shah said: \"That's when things will get a whole lot tougher.\"</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestutm_source=msn.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=msn-slideshow&utm_campaign=bodyurl?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\">Visit the Business Insider homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>One of the biggest hurdles facing stocks existed well before the pandemic and only got bigger through 2020, a top Wall Street strategist says.&#160;</p><p>Stock valuations sit near record highs despite the broader economy still operating well below pre-pandemic levels and slowing its pace of recovery. Equities ran \"far ahead of economic realities\" in 2019, a disconnect that only intensified during the COVID-19 crisis, Seema Shah, chief strategist at Principal Global Investors, said in an October 28 <a href=\"https://blog.principal.com/2020/10/28/short-and-sharp-2020-the-year-when-nothing-really-changed-for-markets/\">blog post</a>.</p><p>Last year's dislocation between growth and value stock performances also widened through 2020. Such gaps pose significant risks to stocks until they're addressed, Shah said.</p><p>\"2020 is the year we would all like to forget — and somehow, equity markets have already done just that,\" Shah said. \"Indeed, just as it was in late 2019, fundamentals and valuations appear to be of limited relevance in this market.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stocks-to-buy-and-avoid-in-3-election-outcomes-stifel-2020-10?r=gr-sub\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Stifel asked its analysts to identify stocks most likely to be positively or negatively affected by the election results. Here are the dozens of stocks to buy or avoid in each of the 3 outcomes.</a></em></p><p>Much of the market's gains can be tied to the Federal Reserve's unprecedented policy support. The central bank's asset purchases, credit-market backstop, and historically low rates helped pull investors back into the market and stave off bankruptcies expected to take place through the recession. Investors who stuck with the \"don't fight the Fed\" strategy should continue to do so in 2021, because monetary policy support is the \"key determinant\" for markets next year, Shah said.</p><p>But just as the central bank's support lifted markets, the unwinding of such aid could slam valuations. The Fed is expected to keep rates near zero for several years to aid the nation's recovery, but markets have grown unhealthily dependent on low rates, Shah said.</p><p>Once economic activity returns to pre-pandemic highs, the US will inevitably need to turn its focus to its massive debt pile. Markets are poised to face some turbulence as the Fed retracts its policy support and reins in the liquidity that helped pad the economy — and investors — from additional damage.</p><p>If the first part of the market's recovery came from the central bank's support, the Fed's withdrawal will kick off a new, more challenging climb, Shah said.</p><p>\"Part two of the story will involve dealing with the inevitable hangover of policy, debt levels, and dependency on low rates,\" Shah added. \"That's what things will get a whole lot tougher.\"</p><p><strong><em>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</em></strong></p><p><strong><em><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-strategy-financials-cyclicals-rise-treasury-yields-morgan-stanley-2020-11-1029754914\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Investors should boost bets on financial stocks and cyclicals before Treasury yields rebound, Morgan Stanley says</a></em></strong></p><p><strong><em><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-news-today-indexes-presidential-election-fomc-meeting-oil-2020-11-1029753940\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" warning that the upcoming election could trigger a prolonged period of stock-market chaos — one that's much worse than the aftermath of 2016</a></em></strong></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the (Ben Winck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fa0598b69331a0011bc6cac?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn85@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-57-281_e4d7efa25cb2de06.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=fuuBlByrtDc:jDxfH1AJzqg:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn71@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-50-233_6d843612d2843803.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=fuuBlByrtDc:jDxfH1AJzqg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn82@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-49-039_9161e4be54dc3a49.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=fuuBlByrtDc:jDxfH1AJzqg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn81@2020_2/2020/11/03/05-31-50-289_0a348b42779eb00c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/fuuBlByrtDc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn23@2020_5/2020/11/03/05-31-49-530_f6c7904b7b6af9e0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490590},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"Why winning in Florida is a must for the Trump campaign","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-winning-florida-is-a-must-for-the-trump-campaign-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7739f40ab50d00184adcc9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"trump florida rally\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump speaks during a rally in Pensacola, Fla., Friday, Dec. 8, 2017.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Trump/ae0e606b14c54c93890c41f2a1daae3f/14/0\" target=\"_blank\">Jonathan Bachman/AP</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>If President Donald Trump is to win a second term as president, his main pathway is through Florida.</li>\n<li>\"In our simulations, when Trump wins, he carries Florida 90% of the time,\" said Decision Desk HQ Director of Data Science, Scott Tranter.</li>\n<li>According to forecasting from <a href=\"https://forecast.decisiondeskhq.com/president/P2020FL\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://forecast.decisiondeskhq.com/president/P2020FL\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">DDHQ</a>, former Vice President Joe Biden has a 63% chance of defeating Trump in Florida. Recent polling from October 27 to October 31 by the <a href=\"https://int.nyt.com/data/documenttools/az-fl-pa-wi/bc6b622f38350414/full.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://int.nyt.com/data/documenttools/az-fl-pa-wi/bc6b622f38350414/full.pdf\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">New York Times Upshot and Siena College</a> estimates Biden has a 3 percentage point edge.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Both campaigns have set their sights on Florida — and for good reason.</p><p>According to <a href=\"https://forecast.decisiondeskhq.com/\">Decision Desk HQ</a> Director of Data Science and Race Call Team, Scott Tranter, a Trump victory in Florida is imperative to winning a second term in office.</p><p>\"In our simulations, when Trump wins, he carries Florida 90% of the time,\" Tranter said.</p><p>Election forecasting models work by determining a state of the race based on polling and other input data about race fundamentals, and then by randomly simulating the outcome of the election a certain number of times. Of all of the&#160; simulations that yielded a victory for President Donald Trump, he won without the Sunshine State only in 10% of them.</p><p>Florida has long been known as a major swing state in the presidential election — the state has flipped which party it votes for in the presidential election <a href=\"https://www.270towin.com/states/florida\">six different times</a> since 1972. Of all of the states which Trump flipped from blue to red in 2016, Florida has the most electoral votes: 29.&#160;</p><p>In the absence of a win in Florida, Trump's path to 270 electoral votes gets harder.&#160;</p><p>\"The mathematical path to a Trump victory without Florida is straightforward,\" said Tranter. \"Trump can win by simply repeating his 2016 map, but with only Florida defecting to Biden. If Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, and Michigan all remain with Trump, then his remaining 2016 map is enough to get him to 270 electoral votes.\"</p><p>If Trump loses Pennsylvania and Florida, then he must count on victories in states like Colorado or Virginia: two states which Hillary Clinton won in 2016 and where Trump currently trails by over ten points in the polls. Hence, the importance of Florida.</p><p>According to further forecasting from&#160;<a href=\"https://forecast.decisiondeskhq.com/president/P2020FL\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://forecast.decisiondeskhq.com/president/P2020FL\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">DDHQ</a>, Biden has a 63% chance of defeating Trump in Florida. Recent polling from October 27 to October 31 by the&#160;<a href=\"https://int.nyt.com/data/documenttools/az-fl-pa-wi/bc6b622f38350414/full.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://int.nyt.com/data/documenttools/az-fl-pa-wi/bc6b622f38350414/full.pdf\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">New York Times Upshot and Siena College</a> estimates Biden has a 3 percentage point advantage.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/why-winning-florida-is-a-must-for-the-trump-campaign-2020-10'>Business Hall)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f7739f40ab50d00184adcc9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn19@2020_6/2020/11/03/05-31-39-543_068de77f1963ee65.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-55-293_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AOtel0GV2dc:a37O2ML_OXE:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn7@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-43-654_a49be1adc5644772.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AOtel0GV2dc:a37O2ML_OXE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn23@2020_4/2020/11/03/05-31-58-673_fd9b58840005d31d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=AOtel0GV2dc:a37O2ML_OXE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn68@2020_3/2020/11/03/05-31-47-553_0b87b47eb056b8cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/AOtel0GV2dc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn25@2020_1/2020/11/03/05-31-35-881_7d06dc2a82e48dd1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604381490574},{"createdTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","updatedTime":"2020-11-03 13:31:30","title":"20 virtual wine tastings hosted by vineyards, experts, and winemakers from around the world","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-virtual-wine-tastings","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p>\n<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec3ee7f5af6cc4f0a706ce4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"virtual wine tasting\" height=\"4016\" width=\"5355\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption> \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Getty Images</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\">\n <li>Although states have begun phased reopenings following lockdowns due to the novel coronavirus, some states are experiencing an uptick in cases now and many people are still turning to online experiences for socializing.</li>\n <li>Wineries, winemakers, and wine connoisseurs are bringing the vineyards and tasting rooms straight to living rooms with virtual wine tastings.</li>\n <li>Many of the virtual tastings are free to join, and some ship wine right to your door as part of the package.</li>\n <li>Read more: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/at-home-cocktail-recipes-from-hotel-bars\">14 signature cocktail recipes from hotel bars around the world — plus the tools and spirits you'll need to make them</a></li>\n</ul>\n<p>Although states have begun phased reopenings and outdoor dining is an option in many places, most people still aren't gathering in groups. And with an uptick in cases happening in several states, many people still aren't comfortable or allowed to travel to vineyards or sit inside tasting rooms. But that doesn't mean you can't virtually gather with family, friends, or coworkers and enjoy uncorking a favorite bottle of wine.</p>\n<p>While in-person tasting rooms may not be an option for everyone right now, many places are bringing tastings, classes, and events directly to living rooms instead.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Virtual wine tastings are a fun way to connect, learn something new, and discover new wines. It's also an ideal way to take your tastebuds on a mini-vacation without putting on real pants. Sip a fruity Sauvignon Blanc from New Zealand or relish a Cabernet Sauvignon from Napa Valley — you might even get some <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/travel\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">inspiration for your next post-COVID trip</a>.</p>\n<p>Many of the tastings are free to join, and some will send wine directly to your door as part of the package. For those that require buying your own bottles, it's easier than ever to order wines directly from vineyards or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/alcohol-delivery-buy-online\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">from a local alcohol delivery service</a>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\n<p>I recently tried a <a href=\"https://coursehorse.com/nyc/classes/cooking/tasting/wine/virtual-wine-tasting-101\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">virtual wine tasting myself on Coursehorse</a>. I'm no stranger to in-person tastings thanks to my background as a travel editor, and I remember the days of drinking Chianti in Tuscany, throwing back cava in Catalonia, and sipping Chardonnay in Sonoma. I was hesitant at first about doing a virtual class since wine tastings are such sensorial experiences. A huge part of the fun for me has always been looking out at a stunning vineyard view, chatting with whoever is pouring the wine, and sometimes even getting a chance to tour the cellars and learn about the winemaking process.</p>\n<h2>Enjoy more great virtual experiences:</h2>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\">\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hotel-airbnb-virtual-experiences\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">18 hotels and Airbnbs around the world are currently offering virtual classes in lieu of their usual on-site activities and events — almost all of them are free</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/online-airbnb-experiences-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Airbnb is now offering online experiences via Zoom video calls. I tried 2 of them and would readily sign up for more — here's why</a></li>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-travel-movies-streaming\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best travel movies to stream right now, from classics like 'Roman Holiday' to animations like 'Moana'</a></li>\n</ul>\n<p>However, when a couple of friends from college I haven't been able to see in person for months suggested taking a Wine Tasting 101 class, it sounded like a fun way to reconnect with them. Plus, I was also eager to take a break from my usual quarantine activities of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bread-baking-tools-supplies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">bread baking</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jigsaw-puzzles-for-adults\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">puzzles</a> to try something new.</p>\n<p>We ordered our wines on <a href=\"https://drizly.sjv.io/c/196318/567662/9425?u=https%3A%2F%2Fdrizly.com%2Fhome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Drizly</a> and joined the class via Zoom. While the particular class we did was geared towards beginners, I still picked up quite a bit of new wine knowledge. My fiancé, who's typically more of a craft brew guy than a gentleman of fine wines, also enjoyed the introductory level and the interactive aspect to the class since he was able to ask questions as we went.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>We opted for a group class so we didn't know who was joining in. If you really want the experience of having it just be your group, I suggest booking a private tasting, which many of the below options offer. We chose to connect more privately after instead, hopping on our own Zoom call over the last glass of our favorite wine from the class to discuss the tidbits we'd picked up.</p>\n<p>Despite my initial misgivings, it ended up making for a fun evening and I discovered a new favorite Sauvignon Blanc I'll definitely be drinking again in the future. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</p>\n<h2>Here are 18 virtual wine tastings to try at home:</h2> \n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n  Wine Tasting: Sensory Techniques for Wine Analysis on Coursera \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec2d9a2f0f41970df38b3a6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Wine Tasting Class\" height=\"819\" width=\"1092\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Coursera</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p>For those who want to seriously up their wine tasting skills while quarantining, Coursera offers a free class from UC Davis to turn beginner sippers into pro sommeliers. The class takes roughly 14 hours to complete. Throughout the class, students build sensory vocabulary to describe wine, learn to identify various faults in different varietals, discover classic wine types of the world, delve into food pairings, and more. The course culminates in a peer review project using all the knowledge developed throughout the course to assess a specific wine.</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>Free</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> No. Students will need to purchase the necessary wines on their own. Coursera anticipates that the total cost of the wines through the class is $150 to $250.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>Sign up on <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&amp;xs=1&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fwine\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coursera here</a>.</p> Enriquez Estate Wines \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa0812a1df1d5001821871f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best virtual wine tastings Enriquez Estate Wines\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Enriquez Estate Wine</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p>Owned by award-winning Latina winemaker Cecilia Enriquez, <a href=\"https://enriquezwines.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Enriquez Estate Wines</a> is a family-operated winery in Sonoma, California. With the holidays quickly approaching, the winery realizes that spending time with family may be virtual for many this year and they're aiming to help make that time special still.</p>\n <p>Enriquez Estate Wines' Virtual Holiday Party Pack is an excellent way to virtually celebrate and safely reconnect with family, friends, or colleagues this season. Cecilia will lead a private guided virtual tasting experience as tasters enjoy a two-pack of premium Brisa and Tempranillo wines and a Cheese &amp; Charcuterie Nosh Box.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>$125 plus shipping</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> Yes.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>To book the virtual tasting, contact <a href=\"mailto:meredith@enriquezwines.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">meredith@enriquezwines.com</a>.</p> Wine.com \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec2d2b43f73707dbc41c974?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Star Studded Virtual Wine Tastings at Wine.com\" height=\"225\" width=\"300\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Globe Newswire</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p>The popular wine website is tapping winemakers, wine critics, and other pros for a series of <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&amp;mid=2025&amp;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2Fcontent%2Flanding%2Fvirtual-tastings%23\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">free virtual wine and spirit tastings</a>. Join Invivo X creators Sarah Jessica Parker, Rob Cameron, and Tim Lightbourne for a tasting of their inaugural New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc and Provencal Rosé, or get to know the trailblazers of the Oregon wine scene as they share stories about winemaking, artistry, and entrepreneurship.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>Free</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> No. Each event includes specific wines or spirits that go along with the tastings that can be <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&amp;mid=2025&amp;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">purchased directly from Wine.com</a> when signing up.</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>Register for <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&amp;mid=2025&amp;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2Fcontent%2Flanding%2Fvirtual-tastings%23\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">virtual tastings here</a>. A Zoom link is sent out ahead of time.</p> Virtual Wine Tasting 101 on Coursehorse \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec2cf67f0f4196ad308f333?format=jpeg\" alt=\"virtual wine tasting coursehorse wine 101\" height=\"695\" width=\"927\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Coursehorse</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p><a href=\"https://coursehorse.com/nyc/classes/cooking/tasting/wine/virtual-wine-tasting-101\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Virtual Wine Tasting 101</a> is ideal for beginner tasters interested in learning basic wine terms, how to properly taste wine, and trying different varieties to decide what wines most appeal to your palette. The two-hour, interactive class begins with a brief introduction to how wine is made and teaches wine newbies to speak confidently about acidity, legs, body, and more fundamentals through five different wines. It can be booked as part of a regular group lesson or as a private event.</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>$25 per person</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> No. Participants will need to buy the specific wines themselves ahead of time, but all of the wines are easily accessible at most wine shops and through <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/alcohol-delivery-buy-online\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">alcohol delivery services</a>.</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>Sign up on <a href=\"https://coursehorse.com/nyc/classes/cooking/tasting/wine/virtual-wine-tasting-101\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Coursehorse here</a>. A Zoom link and PowerPoint will be emailed out just before the tasting begins.</p> Bottles Nation \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f1856d93f737047d322cb16?format=jpeg\" alt=\"87102578_565315960860443_8723744882222432256_n\" height=\"720\" width=\"960\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Bottles Nation</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p>Started by sommelier Michael Bottigliero, <a href=\"https://www.bottlesnation.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Bottles Nation</a> has transitioned their usual in-person tasting events to online offerings due to COVID-19. Bottles Nation is not associated with any specific wineries so the sommeliers don't push specific brands and instead focus on sharing their true favorite bottles.</p>\n <p>The company runs tastings for individuals, as well as accommodating events and parties and multiple people can join in from up to six different locations for the same starting flat fee.&nbsp;</p>\n <p>For those in the mood for something other than wine, Bottles Nation also has beer and mixology tasting options.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>$150 for one hour&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> No. You can purchase wines yourself or order directly from Bottles Nation when you sign up.</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>Sign up on <a href=\"https://www.bottlesnation.com/-virtual-wine-tasting-events\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Bottles Nation here</a>. After signing up, they will contact you directly to set up a time for a Zoom call.</p> Chandon \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f185bf23f73704cc5741809?format=jpeg\" alt=\"virtual wine tastings chandon\" height=\"399\" width=\"532\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Chandon</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For wine drinkers interested in joining a wine club and participating in ongoing tastings of bubbly, <a href=\"https://www.chandon.com/en-US/content?cid=club-chandon-about\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chandon.com/en-US/content?cid%3Dclub-chandon-about&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1595517561767000&amp;usg=AFQjCNEAjQOW07sI7Iv88vNm_3DjJUZyMA\">Club Chandon</a> was the first Napa Valley wine club and has been sharing bottles for decades.</p>\n <p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Chandon's wine club allows members to explore Chandon's wine collection, get discounted, prices, and gain access to virtual tastings led by head winemaker Pauline Lhote. While the winery is known for its sparkling wines, there are options to join the Sparkling Wine Club or the Sparkling &amp; Still Wine Club. Both options are shipped six times a year and are fully customizable.&nbsp;</p>\n <p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For those who just want to explore, previous tastings are available online <a href=\"https://www.chandon.com/en-US/content?cid=article-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chandon.com/en-US/content?cid%3Darticle-1&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1595517561767000&amp;usg=AFQjCNH0SckQEV_m2fTpnyA0qrc3cu6S3w\">here</a> and the Virtual Tasting I wines that go with it can be purchased <a href=\"https://www.chandon.com/en-US/virtual-tasting-set-vol.-1/SetVirtualTastingVol1.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chandon.com/en-US/virtual-tasting-set-vol.-1/SetVirtualTastingVol1.html&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1595517561767000&amp;usg=AFQjCNH3vWeIbeQ_9jIWhKNMm_hwcanOSg\">here</a>.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>~$130 per shipment</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> Yes.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>Virtual tastings have been confirmed for August, October, and December. Sign up for the Chandon newsletters to be notified for the next virtual tasting <a href=\"https://www.chandon.com/en-US/explore/stay-connected.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.chandon.com/en-US/explore/stay-connected.html&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1595517561767000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGgsQ9sNhrKes0UubEFWt5v_S1fMg\">here</a>.</p> Corkbuzz \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec2cf985af6cc7bd13f2ba5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"virtual wine tasting corkbuzz\" height=\"650\" width=\"866\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Corkbuzz</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p><a href=\"https://www.corkbuzz.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Corkbuzz</a> is offering a series of virtual one-hour wine classes taught by varying experts and broken down by region. Taste your way through Napa Valley or learn the basics of Burgundy. Classes discuss everything from the geography and soil to the winemaking techniques and popular varietals of each specific region. The classes are fairly informal and participants are encouraged to sip along with any theme-relevant bottle.</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>$10 per person&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> No. You can <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/alcohol-delivery-buy-online\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">buy any wine</a> from that region to enjoy while following along.</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>Sign up on <a href=\"https://www.corkbuzz.com/store/events/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Corkbuzz here</a>. Zoom links are sent the morning of the class and follow-up notes are sent the next day.</p> Bouchaine Vineyards \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec2d31f5af6cc7d760483c7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"virtual wine tasting bouchaine\" height=\"1300\" width=\"1733\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Bouchaine</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p>A personal favorite winery in Napa, <a href=\"https://bouchaine.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Bouchaine</a> is offering customized 50-minute virtual tastings to bring California wine country right to your couch. Select from three different options depending on your knowledge and experience: Winemaker 101, 201, or 301.</p>\n <p>Predictably, 101 is best for casual wine sippers who want to learn basics like how wine gets its color and how the same grapes can be made into completely different wines. Meanwhile, Winemaker 301 focuses on clones (different grape vines that are grafted together) and delves into topics like differences in aroma and flavor in Pinot Noir clones. Every class is with a live host overlooking the stunning estate vineyards. Once you purchase your wines, you'll be able to set up a private time that works with your schedule for the wine tasting.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>$59</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> Yes. Classes include two, three, or four wines from the vineyard depending on the level and are shipped directly to your door.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>Select your <a href=\"https://bouchaine.com/visit/virtual-wine-tastings/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">experience here</a>. Once you've purchased, you can schedule a private tasting session via phone or email.</p> Matthiason \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec3f24ef34d054f3d66eeb3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best virtual wine tasting 3\" height=\"720\" width=\"960\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Matthiasson Wines</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p>You definitely want a taste of <a href=\"https://www.matthiasson.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Matthiason</a>, a six-time James Beard Award nominee and Winemaker of the Year according to \"Food &amp; Wine Magazine.\" Luckily for wine enthusiasts everywhere, the winemaker is offering complimentary private tastings online to everyone who purchases a Tasting Pack or a Wine Club Membership.</p>\n <p>Get an inside look at the stories behind the wines and all your wine questions answered. If you do decide to join the wine club, you'll also enjoy priority access to member-only and limited production wines, as well as 15% savings on all wine purchases.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>Free with purchase of a Tasting Pack or Wine Club Membership. Tasting Packs start at $249 for 6 bottles. Wine Club Membership starts at $315 for 6 bottles.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> Wine must be purchased to participate in a tasting.</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>After purchasing, reserve your spot in a <a href=\"https://www.matthiasson.com/visit\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">private tasting via Zoom here</a>.</p> Stony Hill Vineyard \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec3f2aff0f41944784c0c0a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best virtual wine tasting 5\" height=\"1365\" width=\"1820\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Stony Hill Vineyard</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p>Stony Hill Vineyard features three different virtual experiences. Sign up for a <a href=\"https://www.stonyhillvineyard.com/Events/Virtual-Tasting-Dates\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">virtual Zoom tasting</a>, join a <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/stonyhillvineyard/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stony Hill Social Hour on Instagram Live</a>, or take it to the next level and enjoy&nbsp; Club Member-Exclusive virtual meetups after <a href=\"https://www.stonyhillvineyard.com/Join/Wine-Club\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">becoming a member</a>.</p>\n <p>To enjoy a 45-minute Zoom tasting, purchase a Virtual Tasting Pack to be delivered to your door, then sign up for a time slot that works for you online. An employee will guide you through each of the wines and give an update of what's happening at the ranch. If you want the tasting to be a private event for just you and friends, call ahead of time to arrange it.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>Virtual Tasting Packs start at $124. She typically hosts small group wine workshops in her gorgeous loft apartment in Lyon's Croix-Rousse, but has moved her tasting experiences online. Join others from around the world for a free virtual happy hour via Zoom. If you'd like something a little more structured, you can also sign up for a private wine tasting either for yourself or a group.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>Free to join the virtual happy hour. Every Thursday, wine lovers are invited to take part in exclusive virtual tastings guided by celebrity sommeliers. Participants can <a href=\"https://www.benchmarkwine.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">buy bottles from Benchmark</a> for the event, or just crack open a bottle of whatever is handy. If you want to support the foundation, you can donate to participate on-screen and ask questions throughout. Every Wednesday <a href=\"https://www.ackerwines.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Acker Wines</a> offers virtual vintage tastings and every Friday is lunch in the vineyards, both via Zoom. Both events have a different expert host each week, from distributors to acclaimed columnists. Participants can see which wines will be featured before signing up and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/alcohol-delivery-buy-online\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">order them online</a>.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price:</strong> Free to register.</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> No. Attendees can see which wines will be featured to order them ahead of time.</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>Register for virtual tastings and lunch in the vineyards <a href=\"https://www.ackerwines.com/pages/Live-tasting-with-JK\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">online here</a>.</p> The Supper Share \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec2d7c53f7370026d0a2334?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Virtual Wine Tasting\" height=\"951\" width=\"1268\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">The Supper Share</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p><a href=\"https://www.thesuppershare.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Supper Share</a> was created in March 2020 specifically to help sommeliers, chefs, and restaurant professionals find new opportunities to share their expertise and talent while many people continue to shelter in place due to the novel coronavirus. Fill out a simple form, choose a wine theme, and they take care of the rest. Within 48 hours, they'll connect you with a sommelier, provide a retail link to order your wines, send a custom invite for everyone in the group to use to connect virtually. You can also set up customized virtual dinner parties, cocktail classes, and more.</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>Packages start at $75 per person.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> Yes. Participants will receive a link to order wines after signing up. Every tasting is a little different, but past events have ranged from blind tastings of Pinot noirs to a chardonnay tasting that included a mini cooking lesson.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>Free</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> No. Buy wines from the specific winery or sip along with whatever you have on your bar cart.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>Depends on the event. After placing an order, a Ponzi team member will gather each participant's delivery address and send a package to each person. Packages can be entirely and you can even get custom Ponzi wine glasses included.</p>\n <p>Each experience is led by an experienced Ponzi Wine Ambassador who will walk your group through the wines.</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>$200 for four people</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> Yes. Bottles are sent directly to every participant.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>Sign up <a href=\"https://www.ponzivineyards.com/Virtual/Guided-Tastings\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</p> Chateau Montelena \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec2df551918247f5915a9cb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_8645\" height=\"4000\" width=\"5333\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Chateau Montelena</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p>Every week, catch winemaker Matt Crafton host&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/chmontelena/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://protect-us.mimecast.com/s/yhozCrkNO0Sn7o9SzK591/&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1589913917437000&amp;usg=AFQjCNHt8yp410F4QFQsrlLabXV7uCRQJQ\">Instagram Live</a> sessions, where he'll lead viewers through virtual tastings, cellar tours, vineyard visits, and more. For those wanting a one-on-one tasting, the winery has introduced virtual, Chateau Montelena tastings for guests to get the Napa experience from the comforts of home. Guests can connect with one of Montelena's live, virtual hosts for an appointment tailored to personal wine preferences.</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: </strong>Free to watch on Instagram.</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> No. You can order wines <a href=\"https://shop.montelena.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">directly from the winery</a>.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>How to join:&nbsp;</strong>Follow Montelena on <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/chmontelena/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Instagram</a>. For a virtual appointment, email <a href=\"mailto:wineclubs@montelena.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">wineclubs@montelena.<wbr />com.</a></p> Kosherwine.com \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ee144d73ad8611820653b14?format=jpeg\" alt=\"kosher wines virtual wine tasting\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">KosherWine.com</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p><a href=\"https://www.kosherwine.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Kosherwine.com</a> has teamed up with the Israeli Wine Producers Association for a weekly virtual wine series. Novices and oenophiles alike can enjoy the free live-streamed events now through July 5. Each event focuses on a different Israeli wine producer whose notable products are widely distributed across the US and beyond.</p>\n <p>Participants are encouraged to submit questions for the expert prior to these sessions, and one lucky winner will receive a free bottle of wine and a VIP winery tour for each live event.</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price:</strong> Free to live stream</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?&nbsp;</strong>No. Viewers can purchase Sampler Sets from each winery at a discounted price to taste along with the experts or enjoy afterward.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>How to join:</strong> Visit <a href=\"https://www.kosherwine.com/experiences\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Kosherwine.com/experiences</a> for a full schedule, to register, and to catch up on past episodes.</p>\n <p>&nbsp;</p> Kendall-Jackson \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ee141baf34d0505f54586d3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"kendall jackson virtual wine tasting\" height=\"319\" width=\"425\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">Kendall-Jackson</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p>Kendall-Jackson recently launched a new series called <a href=\"https://www.kj.com/events/virtual-cooking-series\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.kj.com/events/virtual-cooking-series&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1591906493119000&amp;usg=AFQjCNFPvkoJRuqLzumWBSJFfHRnoTBfHw\">At Home with Kendall-Jackson</a>, a virtual cooking series featuring weekly hands-on demonstrations hosted by the winery's culinary team on Wednesdays at 7 p.m. ET. Viewers can learn firsthand how to cook wine country fare and how to wine pair from the comfort of their homes.</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price:</strong> Free to join on Zoom</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?&nbsp;</strong>No. BYOB your favorite Kendall-Jackson wine or whatever you have handy.</p>\n <p><strong>How to join:</strong> Wine&nbsp;lovers can join this<a href=\"https://zoom.us/j/99852741063?pwd=ZjJYT2JtMmdFMG9OWk42RFBBa3k5QT09\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://zoom.us/j/99852741063?pwd%3DZjJYT2JtMmdFMG9OWk42RFBBa3k5QT09&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1591906493119000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGAqJhGFHRh-QXu7vPS9dLp4U85cw\">&nbsp;link for the Zoom Webinar</a> with password KJCULINARY.</p>\n <p>&nbsp;</p> A la Francaise Champagne \n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa087e51df1d5001821874b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best vitual wine tastings ala francais champagne\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\"> \n   <figcaption> \n    <p class=\"copyright\">A la Francaise</p> \n   </figcaption> </img>\n </figure> \n <p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Champagne lovers can enjoy learning about the iconic bubbles from the source. Discover the Champagne region in France via a virtual experience with <a href=\"https://www.alafrancaise.fr/en/champagne/champagne-region\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">A la Francaise Champagne</a>.</p>\n <p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Guests can join a one-hour virtual Zoom tour with a local expert and pop their open bottle of Champagne to enjoy during the experience. The tour is available to join every day of the week at four different times to best accommodate a range of time zones.&nbsp;</p>\n <p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For a more intimate and immersive experience, you can also arrange for a private tour with Champagne sent to your doorstep ahead of time.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Starting price: ~</strong>$17.50 (€15) for the standard tour; ~$116 (€100) for a private tour&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>Wine included?</strong> No, but it can be arranged for private tours.&nbsp;</p>\n <p><strong>How to join: </strong>Sign up for a virtual Zoom tour <a href=\"https://www.alafrancaise.fr/en/champagne/47-virtual-tour-secrets-champagne\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</p>\n <p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&nbsp;</p>\n <p
